review_body: ProsThe breakfast is great, the gym is huge and great, the hotel is interesting, the room has modern.ConsThe location is not that great and they have more western choices than Japanese choices in the breakfastOverall I highly recommend this place but the location isn't that great.

The hotel was amazing, definitely try out the bar and get the Guatemalan harmony if it's still there! Great service with very friendly staff! The views from the room are worth it! The elevator was very pretty and the lobby had a pianist and welcome drink waiting for us. Would recommend to anyone looking to unwind.

Andaz is a hotel that gives me a home away from home feeling. The staff are very accommodating, and their English speaking level is above average. There is a concierge male staff who was very helpful and he had offered many suggestions and recommendations on restaurants. The hotel is attached to a shopping mall, but the mall is quite quiet. Location of Andaz is a bit off from most of the tourists’ access spots. Taking taxi is unavoidable. The underground station is close by and depending on where you go, some popular destinations may need to change several times. I was very content staying in the Andaz and wasn’t looking too much of going else where apart from enjoying the service and its Japanese restaurant and a roof top bar!

Frustratingly, the only reason I started this Tripadvisor account was to poorly rate this hotel. As a Globalist member of Hyatt, I expected better from Andaz Tokyo, but sadly it was the worst experience I've ever had.My wife and I were snacking at the club lounge and decided to dine at the Tavern Bar and Grille Restaurant at the hotel, but upon requesting a seat, the hostess said she had no seats available. Did not even ask me how many people were dining. Looking at the restaurant, there appeared to be plenty of seats, so I confirmed again if there were any available seats, and she again reiterated there were none available.My wife and I went back to our room and decided to order room service. Before we ordered room service, I wanted to try to make a reservation one more time via phone. The hostess answered the phone and she said she had plenty of seats available. I then asked what changed between the 10 minutes between when I asked in person and when I asked over the phone. Given the sequence of events, I relayed my frustration to the both the restaurant assistant manager and the hotel duty manager. They were perfectly polite and apologetic, but given the terrible feeling my wife and had, we elected to leave the hotel immediately. We live in Tokyo, and this was supposed to be a date night.I'm not sure what sort of discrimination we experienced, but we know when discrimination is being directed against us.Not really angry, just really sad and disappointed we got treated that way.

Just finished a 4 night stay. Staff was 10/10, could not have asked for more. Room (Deluxe corner 5007) was an odd but VERY good design, superb privacy for shower and water closet. Great views! Food at The Sushi, Tavern, and drinks at Rooftop Bar were excellent. The building is spectacular and lots of restaurants on floors 1-3 if for some reason you tire of the hotels offerings. The surrounding area is very nice and very walkable. We loved our stay here and would recommend the property without hesitation.

If you like to feel Tokyo from above in a luxury environment with the fusion of Japanese style mixed with western you choose the right place. Staff was fabulous, extremely helpful and efficient. The room was so comfortable. As a world traveller I really enjoyed the bed, sheets, view, spacious shower. This hotel stands out.

From the moment you step through the door you there is WOW factor. The reception area is classy and personal. Rooms had every thing you could wish for a very comfortable stay whether that be business or leisure. Loved the large bath tubs and included mini bar. There is complimentary wine between 6-8pm in reception which was also a nice touch. You'll get the best views in town from your room and restaurant. We could even see Mt Fuji ! Location was fabulous, an easy walk passing through lovely area's to get to Ginza.

When I arrived, the professional staffs offered the best check in service. They are confident and professional. They also tried to do their best what I requested. Also, it is located on the best position to go any tokyo place.

I stayed at Andaz Tokyo with my husband and my son in August 2019. It was my 2nd time to stay there. Their service is beyond the best and they were super polite but friendly with smiling. When we checked in, the room they gave us didn't have long couch which we enjoyed last time we stayed. So we requested if we can change another room. Despite this sudden request, they accommodated well and changed it to another room with long couch. The view is spectacular. We also enjoyed the pool too. Most of luxury hotels don't allow kids in their indoor pool, but this one was very child friendly and they also provided family changing room. It was so nice and super kids friendly. We would like to stay if our budget allows... Thanks!

Andaz Tokyo Toranomon probably the best hotel I stay in Tokyo so far, the hotel staff are all very nice and helpful. Highly recommend if fit your travel budget. The design is cool and the view from my room is perfect, no complaint and you will enjoy what you paid for.

Everytime I go here I have a great time. My only complaint is that it’s a bit pricey (even for a luxury hotel.... it’s expensive for what you get) and if it rains you have a very noisy sleep since it is beautiful floor to ceiling windows in the rooms. There’s a delicious complimentary happy hour for guests though :) and like i said, always a good time at their bars and restaurants! Just have your AMEX or VISA warmed up, ready to go

Very nice quiet area of Tokyo, what you need after a busy day around town. Amazing service as always! Many nice touch goodies and service around the hotel. If you have stayed at another Andaz before this probably be the best Andaz.

The hotel lobby is on the 51. floor with best view. Modern and elegant interior design. The staff is very friendly, the checkin and out is very comfortable. The breakfast with high quality, and the Happy Hour is an enjoyment. You can find many good restaurants in the vicinity.

I first stayed here in 2017 and the overall quality, experience, product has depreciated steadily over the years. It was excellent in 2017 and part of 2018. It's still very good but I'm disappointed that Andaz hasn't been able to live up to its expectations in the last 2-3 times I've stayed in Tokyo. There is visible wear and tear to furniture, upholstery and general amenities over the years. The service quality hasn't been quite like 2017. Having said that, it's still a great place to stay. One of Tokyo's icons. The location is excellent and this is one of the few hotels that really values and invests in providing its guests an experience where they can truly relax but ensuring the rooms are away from all the hustle and bustle of daily life.

Pros- Rooms were very spacious and comfortable (bed, comforter, pillows, seating); perhaps the largest guest rooms in Tokyo?- The soaking tub was a great amenity- Free non-alcoholic drinks and snacks- Beautiful city views- Great location and convenient walking to subway, Shimbashi, Ginza, etcCons- Fitness room was a bit small; limited strengthening machines- No one to greet us and show us to check-in (difficult to find, unless you've been there before)- Very pricey, but this is TokyoSUMMARYThe hotel was conveniently located to shopping, dining and subway. I was there for 7 days of business and the staff were polite and genuinely helpful with positive attitudes. The rooms were spacious (biggest I've stayed in) and well appointed. Only downside for me was the fitness center, which was relatively small, given the status of this hotel and price. Overall a positive stay, and great for business or couples. Would not recommend for families, due to price, but still a great overall experience.

We recently stayed at the Andaz Tokyo as part of a family trip to Japan .. great hotel , awesome rooms, facilities, amazing outlook from 50th floor rooms and probably the best service I’ve ever experienced in a hotel .. I’ll definitely be back when in Tokyo next

Having tried a number of top hotels in Tokyo on business over the years, I was travelling with my children and wanted to try something new. We stayed here in January for a week in two Tokyo Tower rooms on the 50th floor. We arrived early from the UK and the rooms were ready. The views are fantastic - but as others have said the construction of the tower in front of the hotel isn't great and I worry how high its going to go - but other than the noise of the construction (they did offer, without prompting, the chance to move), it wasn't an issue for us, and we loved gazing out over the city. The rooms are excellent - great big baths and bathrooms, a very comfortable bed, superb housekeeping and good WiFi. The sound insulation is fantastic and the response times for any request was rapid. We used the hotel extensively over the week - the brilliant gym, great swimming pool, stylish sushi restaurant at the top, the burger bar on the ground floor, and the free drinks and free Haribo! There's a lovely vibe at the hotel, and the public areas have been planned very well. Breakfast was great - which we had each day, and the concierge was utterly brilliant - organising us a cookery class, laundry services and getting our bags sent ahead to our next hotel. We had dinner one night in the main restaurant - and that wasn't great at all - but that was our only bad meal of the trip. Cant wait to return!!

I have visited the hotel like once a year for past years, and stayed tokyo tower view. However, there is a construction right next the hotel so it's actually not a tokyo tower view; it's consruction view. Espcially if you would like to book a tokyo tower view with two twin bed, then watch out. They confirme that they only have one 2 twin bed room w/ tokyo tower view on each floor, which has the worst view as the room is located the most far from tokyo tower and the closest from the constuction. The hotel should've let me know about the consruction in advance.

My second visit to Andaz. Everything is good, I even don’t want to try other hotels that are more expensive. I was very impressed by the tower view on my first visit, however, there’s a new building just built up in front of it, blocking the tower view.

This is my second time here, everything’s good, superb tower view and nice staff. Rooms are big enough for group of 2, and there’s also light food serving at the lounge area in the morning, which is really sweet and thoughtful.
user_name:
Manyun D
New York City, New York

review_body: We were so grateful when we arrived at 8:30, tired and jet lagged, and checked in that the room was ready within minutes and we were in before 9:00. Room 4828 was a Deluxe Tower room with views over to the Tokyo Tower and Mt Fuji. There was a complimentary mini bar with soft drinks, a kettle, a Nespresso machine, small mugs. The bathroom was large with a round bath, separate Toto WC and Argan toiletries.This is our favourite hotel in Tokyo and we loved our six nights here.

Blown away by this hotel. Everything is thoughtful and immaculate - from the decor, the views spanning all of Tokyo, the gym / spa and the food. This is an awesome hotel that expresses the local culture in a luxurious way. You won’t regret staying here.

I've always had a fantastic experience at the Tokyo Andaz which I've regarded as one of the most refined hotels in the world in every aspect. However, things have gone downhill. I expect a copy/pasted response like every other 1-star review from them because... well, that's how much they care.1. Every time I've stayed here in the past, no matter how many times I've stayed, I've been greeted upon arrival. After checking in, I am shown my room and how to operate the various features. This is the Andaz experience, well this WAS the Andaz experience.This most recent stay, upon checking in, staff was on their phones/tablets rather than greeting guests. I had to tell the staff that I wanted to check in. No room tour on how to operate the room features. When I came into the room, there was a bottle of bleach in room left from room cleaning. It's appalling for a "5-star" category 7 Hyatt Andaz demanding the top room rates in Tokyo to leave cleaning supplies inside the room.2. When I went to visit the spa, I wasn't offered a tour of the spa facilities, which I have in the past. There was a foreigner man entering sauna and tub without showering and wearing shorts. Unsanitary. We reported this but the staff said "we have signs. we have no control over our guests behavior, I'm sorry." However this is not taking ownership of a mistake/control of the hotel's own operations but putting blame on a customer who wasn't properly educated on cultural standards. Had someone walked him through the facilities and explicitly giving him instructions, these problems could have been avoided. 3. Small details that would happen at a cheap restaurant. During breakfast, we ordered coffee from the Tavern. It didn't come. We had to follow up a few times. Just simple details that a properly trained staff would not miss. During breakfast, someone else's order came to our table. I never had refills offered on my coffee. Dirty dishes were on the table and not removed. This has never happened in the past.You can do much better at a different hotel for the same cost, i.e. Park Hyatt.

I’ve stayed at the Park Hyatt, Four Seasons, Peninsula, and other similar high-end chains, and I was very surprised by the similar hard and soft product offered by the Andaz. The service was fantastic. The food was great. Amazing views, and beautifully appointed room. Highly recommend!

Room: One King Bed with Tower View We are very grateful the hotel upgrade our room as a birthday surprise to my husband. I can see his eyes light up when we entered the room. Kids love the tower but are more interested about the crane right next to it. Pro: 1) Room is consider very big, we asked for a rolled away for my 8 years old, but he can actually sleep on the sofa is he wanted.   Service: Great, Amazing ServiceEveryone we had met at Andaz spoke fluent English. Everyone we met is kind, friendly, and helpful. 1) I had to book two reservation for the 3 nights I was there due to use of my free night certification. The hotel was kind enough to combine my reservation for me so I don't have to check in and out of the room in the middl fo the stay2) Birthday gift - They delivered a birthday gift for my husband's birthday! It was so well and beautifully decorated. 3) Kids - Kids also received special Toranomon hill tiger pillow as their gift. My young son was so excited about he got his own bath robe and slipper. BREAKFAST - It is good. I wouldn't say its amazing but above average. Love the lobby secret " Beverage closet and snack table" its amazing what they have everyday on the table. From mini rice ball sandwich, to gummy bears, to afternoon tea desert. Location: Its a really quiet location. I personally don't mind the little distance walk from metro but its hard with kids when they fall asleep. But the best part is Airport Limousine Bus stop directly at the hotel and this makes travel with kids to airport so much easier. THIS was one of the main reason I booked this hotel at the first place.Overall: This was an amazing stay. We really enjoyed it here. Highly recommend if you are traveling as family. (if you have small kid like us, bring stroller will help).

Service and location is good. Concierge service is very helpful at booking restaurants. It would be better if the welcoming is more personalised. Overall is worth if staying. Good values of Hyatt’s hotel line

Discovering Japan started with an amazing experience at this hotel. The view from my very spacious room was breathtaking! The large bathroom has a huge round bathtub and a space for the rain shower next to it. There’s a good variety (and quality) of food choices for their breakfast buffet. Excellent service at all times and places!

I loved my stay at the Andaz Toranomon Hills. First off, the property is beautiful, located in Mori Tower. The room was large, comfortable, and very tastefully arranged. It had a commanding view of Tokyo (rooms are on the high 40s floor).Like all Andaz hotels I've stayed at, the location was convenient, with good access to the subway, shopping, dining, etc. And of course complimentary beverages and snacks always makes the Andaz feel extremely hospitable when on the road. The staff was also extraordinarily friendly, assisting with travel arrangements, luggage forwarding to our next destination, and the like. I can't comment on "value" because I feel it is often specific to individuals.

This was my third stay in this property, and it remains my all-time favorite. The very spacious and modern standard rooms feel like a suite, and the views are absolutely incredible. It is definitely a bit pricey, and well beyond what I normally pay for room. However, the cavernous rooms and free for all guests 'lounge' (complete with snacks, coffee, and evening wine reception), next to the lobby definitely make a base room comparable to a suite in comparable hotels. The hotel is a short walk to the Toranomon metro stop, as well Shinbashi station (which has a direct rail link to both HND and NRT, as well as countless dining/drinking options just outside the station). There is a lot of construction in this neighborhood, as it is definitely up and coming. I did hear some noise around 9 am from my room on floor 49, so factor that in if you are a late sleeper.Overall, the experience here always leaves me feeling quite energized and refreshed. The hardest part is actually getting the motivation to leave the room, and to be honest, Tokyo is one of the few cities on earth that I love just enough to actually get me out of this door. I definitely plan to return on my next visit to Tokyo, as this hotel has completely spoiled me for the city.

The service from the staff is OUTSTANDING. I highly recommend Andaz for not only how beautiful the hotel is but the view is amazing and the staff truly understands HOSPITALITY. I traveled with 3 of my close friends and we all were extremely happy with the food, service and atmosphere. This hotel is definitely a must; we will be staying here again.

Not knowing what to expect since I wasn’t familiar with this property, I was completely and pleasantly surprised. Every about this hotel was perfect. I love how the hotel occupied the top 7 floors of this 52 story building and the reception desk was on the 51st floor with the rooms all located below. The views from the lobby bar alone make this property exceptional. The rooftop bar was icing on the cake. If you want a very nice property at a great value (for Tokyo) I highly recommend Hotel Andaz Tokyo.

Staff always took the initiative to make sure you feel comfortable and welcomed. A haven after a long day out. Pity the location is far from a main train station, else would be fantastic for families.

Spectacular hotel with amazing room, rooftop bar, buffet Japanese or Western breakfast, or order from menu. Great location near Imperial Palace, shopping district. What a terrific place to stay. This was our first trip to Tokyo since 1984. The hotel rooms are on the top floors in the building -- I think floors 47 to 51. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by staff who escorted us and took our bags to floor 51 to check in. We then were shown to our room on the 47th floor. I don't recall ever checking in on a floor that was higher than where my room was. The room was immaculate, with terrific TV, safe, controls for blackout and sheer curtains, etc. Staff was very accommodating and helpful, especially in assisting us in forwarding luggage to our next destination. The lower floors of the building contain offices and retail, shops, restaurants. We had a delicious Japanese meal in one of the downstairs restaurants (name escapes me). If I ever return to Tokyo I'd stay here again. Highly recommend.

Andaz Tokyo Toranomon Hills is the way Tokyo was meant to be experienced. With outstanding customer service, a private atmosphere, and quality facilities, I am honored to have stayed at this hotel. Travel to and from the hotel grounds is quick, convenient, and comfortable. The rooms provided are nothing short of first class and never disappointed. The restaurants are impeccable with "The Tavern Grill and Lounge" and "The Sushi" being particularly exemplary. The value is unbelievable considering the services provided. My wife and I will be returning without a doubt.

Andaz facilities and hospitality does not disappoint. Everything I expected from an AmEx Fine Hotels property. Views from the hotel are breathtaking. The staff pampered us as the service is impeccable. Highly recommend this property.

Top of range design and a total eye candy. We have enjoyed stayed at Andaz probably most out of many hotels we have stayed in Tokyo. Loved the idea of communal area for hotel guests. The view out of the rooms is unforgettable.

Fantastic hotel, lovely food with plenary of choice. Friendly staff who couldn’t help enough. Easy access to tourist points within the city. Amazing views over Tokyo city. Great Spa with lots of treatments!

Actually - the best hotel in Tokyo.Everything works, everything is clean, the food is excellent, the staff amazing. The location is good as between Ginza and Roppongi. Everyone speaks perfect English of course. As you would expect from Hyatt - a top tier property (and i travel a lot).

So how to you really differentiate between the Grand Hyatt and the Andaz - with a price difference of over $700 it’s hard to see how one could be that much more that the other. The Andaz is impressive - the views are impressive and the service is attentive. Room wise - not much to write home about after the view. Bathrooms are fab and larger than other hotels in Tokyo. Still stuck on the price though. Sorry!!

First of all, ignore the negative posts from people that only have 1 or 2 or 3 posts and surprise surprise they are all negative comments. When reading reviews I take them with a grain of salt and ignore the ones with only 1 or 2 comments that are bad or good. I respect posters that have many stays and reviews.I've stayed in literally hundreds and hundreds of hotels around the world in the past 25 years and this is one of the best. The surprise was fabulous and very attentive. My wife and I stayed here 3 nights for my birthday and it was wonderful. We had room #4913 on the 49th floor and the view was incredible (see photos I took). The room was very spacious with about 600 sq. feet. The bed was very comfortable. I read some posts that mattresses in Asia tend to be hard so I requested ahead of time with the Concierge that they put a mattress pad and extra comforter and it was wonderful. My bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was huge and shower was great with strong pressure and huge soaking bathtub with plenty of room for both me and my wife.The hotel provides a happy hour from 6 PM to 8 PM with snacks, wines drinks complimentary each night. We were too stuffed to partake but it looked really great. You must take the elevator to the 52nd floor to get to the Andaz lobby and then take another elevator to go down to the rooms which are on high floors. I believe 48-51 so all the views are incredible. Everything worked well and thought out. There are plenty of plugs and USB ports all around the bedroom and next to the bed. Nothing worse than not being able to plug in. The black out blinds and shades were great and all electric and did a great job of blocking out the sunlight in the morning.We went down to the breakfast each morning in the lobby level at the restaurant and it was VERY good. As a Globalist, it was included free each morning for us. I believe it's around $40 US per person and that would be well worth it with a wide selection of buffet items and you can order 2 hot items from the menu.There are two subway lines close to the hotel. One is about 5 minutes from the hotel and the other 10 minutes. The hotel provides a "Handy" cellphone included free of charge with the room that has free fast internet service and you can use it with Google Maps and other programs and also has a great city guide on it. I used it throughout the stay and was great not to have to use my own cellphone with capped data while traveling. This was a great benefit that I didn't read about online before we came.WiFi worked well throughout the hotel and was very fast. The spa was very nice and is included free of charge access to it. There is a lap pool and hot tubs and sauna. The water in the hot tub was not hot. It was just luke warm to cool which would have been better if it was hotter.This is a really fabulous hotel. Room rates aren't cheap at around $800 a night with tax and fees but I loved the modern hotel with great view and fabulous service. I'd gladly come back here on my next stay.

The AndezTokyo was a relaxing high-end experience. The views,restaurant, food etc. we’re all outstanding. The room amenities were top notch and spacious The staff was very accommodating, courteous and helpful.

Zero hospitality - the hotel pretends to be cool - it is not at all cool - the staff are impersonal verging on rude. I recommend you to go to another hotel- eg the Park Hyatt which destroys this rubbish hotel on every measure - it was £1000 per night for shoddy, rude, shambolic service. I stayed in 11 hotels in Japan - this was by far the worst

My husband and I stayed at this hotel on our trip to Tokyo. The rooms were well-appointed, clean and quiet. We had the most amazing view of the Tokyo skyline from our room. It was stunning! The lobby decor was sleek and beautiful. All the staff we interacted with was extremely helpful and friendly. They helped us make reservations at local restaurants. The subway was a short walk away in a quiet, residential area. I would recommend this hotel.
user_name:
Christin1014
New York City, New York

review_body: We went to Tokyo for my 30th Birthday and loved every minute of it! It actually ruined all the other hotels for us in Japan b/c we couldn't stop talking about how amazing the Andaz was. We even had a dinner planned at the Park Hyatt and scrapped it to come back to the Andaz b/c we just loved it so much. Every detail was beautiful and then breakfast and happy hour treats were a great touch. The service was amazing and we utilized the spa and rooftop bar as well. One of the best hotel stays we've had in the world! And we've traveled extensively. Cheers to the Andaz and only book here if you come to Tokyo. Thanks for everything! xoxo the birthday girl

Andaz was our first stop in Tokyo. The view of the Tokyo Tower was breathtaking. The room and the bathroom were spotless, incredibly comfortable and functional. The attention to details was amazing. Definitely recommend it to everyone.

We stayed at the andaz at the end of our trip to Japan and every bit about the stay was superb. The staff were extremely friendly, warm and helpful. The location is really central and the view, atop the 50 story tower is hard to beat. The design of the hotel is really what stood out - its luxurious wihtout being over the top. Its warm, inviting and super hip. It was a great place to start the day and even nicer to come back to after a busy day in Tokyo. Thank you Andaz team!
user_name:
BN333
New York City, New York

review_body: My family of four stayed at the Andaz for four nights. The style is modern, tasteful and exceptional. The included ‘happy hour’ provides an impressive selection of wine, sake and food. Close to rail network. I look forward to staying here again.

The rooftop bar is amazing!! With a view to die for, great drinks and a good price range, our experience was perfect with waiter Leo as a host. He was observant, caring and easy talking. A perfect evening in every way.

I loved everything about this hotel! The room, the view from our room, the helpful and friendly staff, the location, the smell (I know, but it's got a great smell!), the breakfast, both the hotel bar and restaurant, the elevator art, the overall design aesthetic, not to mention the complimentary Japanese sodas, candy and matcha almonds near the front desk; everything was incredible.We had previously stayed in the Shinjuku area, which was fantastic but also crazy busy. This hotel is located in the Ginza district and it was a much more calm, uncrowded location. With the Toranomon train station just a couple blocks away, it was very convenient to get to the rest of Tokyo though.Our room had a one-of-a-kind view of Tokyo Tower, fantastic during the day but utterly stunning at night. The room was spacious, the decor was understated contemporary, the tub and shower combo and bathroom truly luxurious. In fact, there's pretty little about the hotel that doesn't feel luxurious! Every possible detail has been considered so that guests will have a wonderful stay. Stay here - you won't regret it!

Great staff, good location-great rooms. From check in to check out the staff were friendly and helpful. The views are second ti none! roof top bar and has a non smoking area. breakfast buffet was spectacular

Wonderful location downtown. Incredibly helpful and friendly staff. The rooms were modern, user friendly and well maintained. The view was spectacular and conveniently within walking distance to shopping and site seeing downtown.

Just the most luxious, perfect hotel I've ever seen. Way above my budget, but it was beautiful. Architecture was exquiste, staff were overly helpful and polite, and the views of Tokyo tower were just the best.

This is probably the nicest hotel I’ve stayed in. No detail has been overlooked: even the aroma of the air is thoughtfully curated! The rooms are spacious and modern, especially large for Tokyo, and the amenities are lovely. Free water and soft drinks from the fridge in the lobby, and a very relaxing pool. Our particular favorite was the daily happy hour which allowed us to mingle with guests and relax before dinner with the unparalleled views the hotel lounge offers. Thanks for a great stay and hope to return soon!

Andaz Tokyo is one of those hotels that never dropped in its service. From arrival at the hotel to check-in and onwards to the room, the service is consistently extremely consiuderate, welcoming and seamless throughout. My wife and I was pleasantly surprised with an upgrade to a suite. It was one of the most amazing room we have ever stayed in.To call it palatial wouldn't be an overstatement. The room boasts view from Tokyo Skytree to Tokyo Tower and beyond. That is nearly 170 degrees of panorama when you walk along the entire length of the room.

The hotel is amazing. The views fantastic and the staff could not do enough for you. They also sent me my passport and keys to the airport which I had left in the hotel safe. I called them and they quickly organized to have my passport delivered to the airport via taxi. ( yes, I know, who forgets their passport, right!?!?!) IHighly recommend the Andaz.

We stayed with 2 children for 3 nights to start our Japan trip and ended up booking last night before going back to US, because it’s a wonderful hotel. Rooms are spacious, bathroom is amazing with big soaking tub and great shower. It is sparkling clean, everywhere you go. Service is wonderful. Hotel is a real “destination” place - there are Japanese traditional touches everywhere that really make your stay special - tea and treats in the room, yukata robes, traditional pattern dishes at the restaurant, bonzai trees, minimalistic design, special fragrance throughout hotel, unique art pieces, one of best views of Tokyo tower, delicious traditional food at the breakfast buffet. It’s like you get special Japanese experiences all in one place right at arrival. Gym and pool are top notch. Roof top patio and seasonal drinks! Toranomon towers also have several great and affordable restaurants that make it easy to grab dinner with family after long day sightseeing. Metro station is just 7 min walk. If I am back in Tokyo - I won’t hesitate to stay here again!

This hotel is located in the working district. While there are not a lot of things within a walking distance, it is a short train ride to all as this location is centralized to the transit system. If America, think Wall Street where the town is light on people for weekend and packed during week days. The hotel is refine and breakfast is on point. We booked with our Amex Plat so we got free this and that.

This week (first week September 2019) we are hosting breakfast discussions led by the head of our Asia Pacific region. He is visiting from Singapore so we reserved a private room on the 51 floor tavern Grill and Lounge. Food is excellent and the service impeccable. of course the ambience superb. Highly recommende.!

Spent a weekend here in the hotel. Our room is facing right in the middle of Tokyo Tower, the view is wonderful specially at night. The design of the hotel room is trendy and mixed with Japanese style. The craftsmanship of the mirror cabinet at the bathroom and the working desk are beautiful. Don’t miss the apéritif which is on the lobby floor with big windows over looking Tokyo!

I had a good stay here. Loved our room with a view of Tokyo Tower. The pool area was fantastic. They had these spas at the pool area that I would recommend anyone to check out. Enjoyed the happy hour in the evening and the staff in general was friendly. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again in future trips to Tokyo but there are so many fine hotels in the city. It's hard to choose just one!

The hotel was elegant, yet in a comforting way that made me feel at home and valued. The service was impeccable -- everyone was so friendly and so caring. From check in (where we could sit in the comfortable lounge while they could check us in as opposed to standing in front of the check out counter) to check out, the experience was fantastic. The spa was breathtaking, the gym well-equipped, the hotel beautiful, the room view amazing, and the service world-class.

Beautiful rooms and gorgeous views made our first visit to Tokyo that much more memorable. Hotel staff communicated well and were very helpful. Indoor pool and spa were picturesque and tranquil. Well worth the price. We will definitely come back!

The Andaz is a beautiful hotel in the heart of Tokyo yet outside of the frustrating bustle of the larger stations. Everything in our stay was perfect, including the lovely bespoke gift they were able to provide for my wife's 30th birthday. We will definitely stay here again.

At first we were skeptical about whether the Andaz Tokyo would be suitable for our family with 2 young kids. But now I am so glad we decided to stay at there as we had an amazing experience there.First, the check-in experience was so relaxing, we hopped off the car and our host immediately sat us down at a beautiful long wooden table in the lounge area on 52nd floor and served us drinks while she explained to us all the hotel amenities and the check-in details. The hotel prepared the room so meticulously it was unbelievable. The rollaway bed for our child was setup with a cute character pillow and kids have their own bath ropes and slippers. They even provided kids sized toothbrush with kids flavored toothpaste! All the non-alcoholic drinks and snacks in the mini bar is complimentary - which is extremely generous. Everything in the room is well designed and functional. But I gotta say the view was our highlight! Our room is on the 49th floor with a panoramic of Tokyo that's almost 180 degrees (from the Imperial Palace to the Rainbow bridge). We had the Deluxe King room which is very spacious for our family of 4. The only wishlist item we had for the room was more storage drawers. We like putting away our stuff neatly instead of spreading them out on tables. Breakfast was included in our package (we booked through the AMEX FHR program). They serve breakfast at the Tavern restaurant with both Western and Japanese food. The selection was great and we can also order items from the A la Carte menu that's included with the breakfast price. Both service and food was amazing and very refined. Lastly I want to mention that because we travel with kids, it was unimaginable for us to experience a Sushi Bar Omakase meal (chef's tasting menu fine dining) but the Andaz made it happen for us! There's a sushi bar called THE SUSHI on the rooftop level that only had 8 seats which is very exclusive. The concierge arranged us to all go there. My wife and I had the Omakase while my kids can sit next to us ordering food from the Rooftop Bar menu (like wagyu burgers, fried chicken, etc) that they love. All 4 of us had a wonderful time and the sushi chef from time to time also give our kids little things to taste too.

I stayed here for a night. From check in to check out, everything detail has been thoughtfully taken care of. The hotel and room were super beautiful, modern and spacious in Tokyo standard. It definitely motivated me to work harder so that I stay here again :).

I love almost everything about Andaz Tokyo, and have stayed there several times. The interior design is very classy, the rooms are spacious and well laid out, the breakfast is the best I've ever had in Japan. However, I had a rather unpleasant experience last night involving a dishonest service staff.I just checked out of the hotel last night after staying for four nights. Upon checking in, I told the front desk team member that I had a late night flight out on the last night and requested as late a check-out as possible. She told me that the hotel was very full, so she could only grant me a 2pm late check-out. I then asked if I could use the shower at the spa before leaving the hotel around midnight for the airport, and she said absolutely, and that I could also use the lobby lounge.On the last night, I went to the spa on Level 37 at around 10:30pm, only to discover that it's closed. I therefore went to the front desk, and the same team member I had spoken to during check-in attended to me. She informed me that the spa closes at 10pm. I asked if there was any way they could let me just use the shower for a while. She asked a colleague, who made a call, and then told me that they did not know how to open the shower, and the person who was in charge of it had already gone home.I was obviously disappointed to hear that. Without me asking anything, she added that she had even checked if there were any rooms I could use, but the hotel was completely sold out for the night, and even the suites were occupied. I therefore left it as that, and decided to go to the airport lounge to shower instead.However right after the conversation, I was fiddling with my phone and out of curiosity went to my Hyatt app to check the availability of rooms that night (August 13th). To my surprise, I saw that rooms were available at Andaz on the night itself, and at relatively decent rates! I clicked further and found that there were three room types available (meaning there were at least three unoccupied rooms) - 2 twin beds, 1 king bed with bay view, and Andaz suite with 2 king beds.In other words, the front desk staff basically LIED to me. And she voluntarily came up with this lie intentionally as it didn't even cross my mind to ask to use the shower in one of the rooms. This is especially shocking in Japan, where people are generally very honest. Such dishonest behavior is just unacceptable. I'm not sure how I can bring myself to return to the hotel and have to constantly question the honesty and integrity of the staff. Most disappointing.

Gorgeous property - the use of wood at Andaz Tokyo is lovely. We were upgraded to a Tokyo Tower view room and had a very comfortable stay. The provided tea in the room seemed to be themed with the season (cherry blossom). The complimentary snacks and beverages were also very tasty.Very nice pool and spa area, which we enjoyed very early in the morning. A swim cap is provided in case you need one.Breakfast was good, with a nice selection that balances both Eastern and Western options. Globalists get the choice of a hot entree (including a Japanese set option) with the buffet spread.The location is conveniently a short walk away from the Toranomon station. Coming from the airport, it is easy to take a train to Tokyo station, then take a taxi ride to the hotel. A conbini is also a short walk away if you needed cheap eats or late night snacks.In typical Andaz style, this property embodies casual-luxury where the hard product is supreme. Do not expect super hands on service - I would recommend some other property like the Park Hyatt if you need a lot of specialty/concierge services. Help is there if you ask for it, but do not expect a lot of polish.Overall, recommended.

This hotel exceeded our expectations. We were fortunate enough to get a deal on a suite (three nights for price of two) and we found out there were perks that came with suites: highest floor, breakfast is included and free mini bar including alcohol. The suite was beautiful with floor to ceiling windows in the livingroom and bedroom. The view was incredible morning and night. The suite bedroom has two king size beds, the only hotel in Tokyo (that I found) to offer that. The bathroom has a soaking tub and separate showers. Two sinks and two toilets which was very handy. There was more than enough room for a family of four. The decor is minimal and beautiful, wood and shoji everywhere. The sofa was very comfortable. The dining table/desk was beautiful. Overall, very well thought out space. The hotel facilities are also beautiful - the lobby and spa. The pool is one of the nicest pools I have used. There are also hydrotherapy pools and hot tubs. There is a complimentary happy hour every evening from 6-8 with delicious snacks and sweets and drinks. The breakfast buffet was delicious, lots of Japanese food which I loved. The staff were extremely helpful and warm. They helped us get reservations and changed our money for us (from large bills into smaller bills). I would return to the Andaz Tokyo in a heart beat.

Stayed here for 5 nights on a family vacation to Japan. Can't explain how magnificent this property is - from the rooms 50 floors up overlooking all of Tokyo to the stunning pool and hot tubs to the nightly live music at the bar. One of my top 5 hotels in the world.
user_name:
nycadman
New York City, New York

review_body: After St Regis in Osaka and Shiraume in Kyoto, this hotel was a big letdown.Nice pool and spa. Enjoyed the rooftop bar and the view of Tokyo from our room. But that was it. The hotel is lacking in atmosphere, the beds are too hard. The consierge service very unknowledgeable and unhelpful. The staff in the breakfast restaurant was bordering on rude. The breakfast not good enough. Should have gone to Park Hyatt.

Andaz is a refreshing change to the TKY hotel scene. Rooms are spacious and modern Japanese although almost trying too hard to be. Staff is very welcoming and rarely is there a wait. Amenities are readitly available both in lobby and in room. Rooftop bar is a great place for a cocktail particularly on a good weather day although a bit pricey for the wine. All in all, if you feel like staying at a Hyatt related hotel and dont want to deal with Roppongi, try this one

Having just left the Andaz today the rest of the accommodation on our trip will have big job in beating the Andaz in style, gorgeous room, every little thing has been thought of to make your stay effortless. The staff are so welcoming, polite and can’t do enough for, unfortunately we couldn’t check in earlier due to our room still being occupied, so decided to wait it out in the Tavern bar and grill, the food is excellent, pricey but tasty and well presented.....the afternoon tea looked amazing, there were lots of tables of ladies very well dressed enjoying these. Though after an 11 hour flight we were beginning to feel a bit grubby’ though my husband and son went off to use the gym which was available to them. The staff were very apologetic we had to wait even though we were early and I got a room upgrade and a gorgeous box of macaroons.The views from the hotel are incredible during the day and night! We could have sat for hours taking it all in.The buffet breakfast is amazing, low of Japanese, western and continental options to choose from. My daughter and I ate breakfast one morning having woken up early with jet lag we were almost first guests in! The other 2 mornings we went to the cafe on floor 3 or 4 which had a great selection of breakfast and coffee options for a fraction of the cost if you aren’t on a B and B rate.I hope to come back one day, couldn’t fault the hotel and couldn’t have wished for a better place to stay to start our holiday in Japan

While visiting Tokyo the previous year, we stayed at the Grand Hyatt (versus The Andaz) based on location only to depart with great disappointment in the overall hotel inclusive of staffing....This summer on a return visit to Tokyo with my son, we opted to experience the Andaz and were certainly not disappointed to say the least: the establishment exudes exemplary five-star service and accommodation.The rooms are spacious and comfortably well appointed constructed thoughtfully in a modern Japanese methodology with the finest of materials, composites and ingredients. With that said, additional drawers for clothing storage would have been a welcome addition. As per Andaz standards, each room includes a mini-bar with complimentary non-alcoholic beverages refilled to your pleasure and a welcome benefit be it for water, juice or a soft drink. The staffing throughout the Andaz Tokyo are conscientious, caring and helpful beyond the call of duty from housekeeping to room service to the concierge desk. Each guest is made to feel valued and special in their own right from the moment of check-in.The Andaz Tokyo Toranomon Hills is decidedly worthy of many a return visit and management is to be congratulated on their accomplished execution.

We booked a deluxe tower view room but got upgraded to a suite. The view was absolutely amazing. the suite was beautifully designed and spacious. Staff were very welcoming.Definitely my best hotel experience in Tokyo ever. Highly recommend.

Great hotel right in the middle of it all. Was able to catch subway or train service within walking distance. Although it was hot during my trip I was still able to catch a taxi and travel south of the hotel and then walk back about 1.5 miles and stop along the way to see several shrines very nice trip and sight seeing adventure. Being up on the 48th floor above the city provided a great view but again due to the heat the haze was thick so could not see as far as you would on a clear day would like to travel back during winter or spring. Highly recommend a trip to the pool area the whirlpool is a great way to relax and rejuvenate after a long walk.

We stayed here as part of our visit to Japan this summer. It's an amazing hotel with awesome views of the city. It's so high up that you can just sit there enjoying the view for some time. The entire hotel is very luxurious - from the separate entrance/elevator, to the check-in and lobby, to the rooms. In our room, we enjoyed the complementary little snacks and drink. And being able to grab some water in their refrigerator on our way out to check the sites was convenient. The room itself was good sized and they brought in a rollaway bed which was convenient for our family of 4. As an aside, it was one of the few big chain hotels in Tokyo in which I could book a reservation for a family of 4 (2 adults and 2 children). Most big chain hotels that I searched for would only take 3 people.There were a couple pastries in the lobby for breakfast. I'm not much of a breakfast person, so they were just fine for me.Overall we had a wonderful stay in Tokyo, and this hotel was part of making it a great vacation.

I stay here every time I go to Tokyo and it the best hotel. It close to every place you need to go and the metro is a 5-10 minutes walk. There a lots of place to eat in Tokyo and it the top notch hotel. You don’t go wrong when you stay at Andaz

I stayed for four nights and the Andaz was top notch! Location is very convenient, the service is outstanding, the room was impeccable, the food was excellent. The staff could not be more friendly and helpful! Highly recommend this hotel and I will go back!

Perfect location to explore Tokyo. Unique view from windows and room design. Free minibar softdrinks. Hotel is located at 47-51 floor of skyscraper. Very unusual and also friendly check in process, not at the reception but at separate table

My husband and I spent our wedding anniversary this past weekend at the Andaz Hotel in Tokyo. We can highly recommend the hotel, stunning views of Tokyo, extremely helpful and attentive service personnel, great gym and pool and tasty breakfast the next morning. Highly enjoyable and just a very fun week- end partly due to the great facility and service.

Absolutely beautiful rooms. The staff and location were perfect. Located near a JR Rail (4 blocks) and lots of local food. VERY safe and explorable area. The amenities and view were a huge surprise. So good

I'm a globalist with Hyatt and this is by far (and away) the best Hyatt property in the world. Rooms are amazing..the atmosphere is relaxing, service second to none. If you are looking for a hotel in Japan ..this is a no brainer.

Stayed here for a week, and absolutely loved it. The hotel is on the top floors of a 50 storey mixed use building. Amazing views. Very classy decor, perfect combination of traditional Japanese and ultra modern Western design.Absolutely flawless, polished perfection levels of customer service.Exceptionally well thought out rooms, with dressing and living areas that are both ultra elegant and well appointed, but very practical and sensible. Lots of storage area for luggage and clothes, that make you feel it's your own apartment, rather than a hotel room. Generous size pool and gym are top notch.The hotel doesn't charge for soft drinks and snacks, neither in the room nor in the lounge, and this is a really welcome perk. Really sets the hotel apart from others that penny pinch.Overall, a superb hotel.

The design of the hotel is really beautiful. Not just another ‘plastic’ hotel, but done very well with great details and materials. We had a small suit with 10 meter of windows from floor to ceiling. An amazing view both at daylight and night time.The suit was as a small apartment with great look and design.Location is really good. Walking distance to central Ginza in a few minutes.

Our stay at the Andaz Tokyo was absolutely amazing. The design and detail of the hotel and rooms were stunning and we felt completely relaxed. It felt intimate and exciting and represented a beautiful side of Tokyo. The guest room was beautiful and very comfortable! We were upgraded to a room with a better view on arrival and were so thankful! We could see the Sky Tree and gardens from our room. The view was stunning as was the dark wood in the bathroom area. It was very relaxing and we greatly enjoyed the signature scent of Summer Bamboo. The whole room was spacious and the large tub in the shower area was just like a spa. We loved the feeling of arriving on the 51st floor for check in and lounge area, it felt very exclusive and welcoming. We also enjoyed the pool and spa area on the 37th floor. The infinity pool and the carbonated pool were extremely relaxing. The food and drinks at the Andaz Tokyo were delicious. The same attention to detail put into the design of the hotel went into the food and drinks. Even the food and drinks offered during cocktail hour were special. The food and drinks at the Andaz Tokyo were delicious. The same attention to detail put into the design of the hotel went into the food and drinks. Even the food and drinks offered during cocktail hour were special. We had amazing drinks at The Tavern lounge and enjoyed a wonderfully fresh fruit trifle. We went to the bottom floor and purchased delicious pastries from the Pastry Shop. We enjoyed drinks and small bites from the Rooftop Bar, the signature Gin and Tonic was especially delicious. The breakfast buffet was amazing and the mango juice and banana waffle were favorites. The most memorable meal was the Saturday brunch at the Tavern Grill. The room they reserved was intimate and had a stunning view. The choices of endless starters, mains and the dessert table were all delicious and it was hard to choose. The asparagus starter and porkchop main were mouthwatering. We upgraded the steak dish to the sirloin and it was one of the best from our Tokyo trip. The dessert table was filled with delectable, handcrafted treats and I couldn't get enough! All of the staff were very friendly but we'd like to highlight Thomas at The Tavern who assisted us during brunch and Mizuki who helped at the luggage counter on the 1st floor. They were both extremely accommodating and had outstanding customer service. Thank you!

If you’re booked into the Tokyo Tower view rooms, it is probably one of the best breathtaking viewing points from a hotel in the city. Stunning. Interior and room layout is spacious, beautifully furnished, well stocked minibar and amenities. Snacks, water, coffee/tea and soft drinks are complimentary. Housekeeping are meticulous and show a great attention to detail in the cleanliness of the hotel. Gym is well equipped. Good lounge with complimentary drinks and canapés at cocktail hour. Breakfast buffet is probably one of the best I’ve eaten in Tokyo, serving plenty of healthy options including multigrain rice, perfect onsen egg, mackerel, and the Ikura is delicious. There are also great Continental breakfast options as well. Brown rice option with the room service menu. Train station is a bit of a walk, especially if you’re catching the Chiyoda line. My only issue in terms of service is: - Concierge: I asked for a restaurant address to be kindly written in Japanese for a taxi driver as too often, halfway the taxi driver may ask for the address again. The concierge said, “The Bell Desk downstairs speak English, they can tell the taxi driver for you.” In all honesty, most Concierge would just write the address and not be lazy about it. - Concierge: Asked to call a restaurant to confirm a reservation and to kindly leave a message in my room with an update. He insisted I wait for him to make the call even though I told him I’m running late. It’s not a big issue but it’s small service issues which shouldn’t happen with a Concierge at a luxury hotel. - Taxi Stand: most hotels have a separate line for hotel guests, Andaz only have one line shared with the Mori Toranomon Hills building. Therefore, as a hotel guest you may have to wait a while sometimes for a taxi. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and will definitely return. The service issue is something I just find quite surprising as most luxury hotels in Japan exude great hospitality and you’d never have to ask twice for something.

The one thing about Japanese hospitality is excellence …About to complete a 4-night stay here - I chose Andaz purely for experience - I've already stayed at a few other Andaz properties, and this one matched the same excellence. Amazing, spacious rooms with views, service comfort and peace.Very expensive...Noted that they could only offer me a twin bedded room, when my preference was for a KIng bed - but doesn't change my conclusions... great stay.

My husband and I stayed at Andaz Tokyo for 3 days during our trip to Japan and it well and truly exceeded our expectations! We arrived at Haneda International Airport and took a 20min ride on the Airport Limousine Shuttle straight to Andaz Tokyo (so convenient!). Instead of waiting in line at a reception table, when we got to the hotel lobby we were seated in the Andaz Lounge where we could help ourselves to drinks, refreshments, snacks (…and a donut wall with matcha flavoured donuts - WIN) and before we knew it it was time to check-in. We stayed in the Andaz Tower View King Room which gave us the most incredible view of the Tokyo Tower and cityscape and the bed was strategically positioned to take full advantage of the view. The bedroom was beautifully designed (sort of like a modern and miminal ryokan) with plenty of space for us to comfortably store our luggage, hang our clothes and lounge around in the hotel’s yukata and slippers.The bed itself is extremely comfortable with all the master switches and blind controls right beside the bedhead..and can I just take a quick moment to appreciate the futuristic toilet seat that was always perfectly heated with automatic open, flush and beyond? It makes going home to our regular toilet a very sad reality hahahaThe minibar also had complementary snacks and non-alcoholic beverages and we were ADDICTED to the wasabi rice crackers!Location-wise, the hotel is quite central and easily accessible (7min walk from the Tokyo Metro and 10mins from the JR Shimbashi). However, the area is a quiet business district which was perfect for us because we wanted to stay somewhere a bit quieter at night.The staff here are also extremely attentive and helpful. At check-in we were given a run-down of the closest sights and and transport options and every request was resolved or answered almost immediately. The hotel prides itself on service and we can definitely see why. And let's not forget one of the most important things - BREAKFAST! The breakfast buffet at Andaz Tokyo is truly one of a kind! Not only does the breakfast dining area occupy a panoramic view floor of the building - the food is exquisite. Andaz Tokyo Toranomon Hills Pastry Shop is also located on ground floor and the fresh pastries are brought up to the breakfast buffet so you basically have a bakery at your fingertips each morning!It’s also quite difficult to find vegetarian options in Japan but with an extravagant buffet spread and diverse ready-to-order menu, there were plenty of vegetarian friendly dishes for me :)Overall, our stay at Andaz Tokyo was true luxury and we definitely felt very well looked after, well fed and well rested in a great location.The only thing we're sad about is that we didn't get enough time to use the pool and spa but we hope to next time we're back!

Well worth the price. Hands down the best value you will find for level of luxury and view and staff in all of Tokyo. Wished we stayed here our entire trip. Will absolutely stay here every time we return.

Great hotel...wonderful service. Stunning views. Hotel rooms are on floors 47 through 50 of skyscraper...so views are all amazing. Coffee and some snacks are in lobby lounge. Wasn't happy with breakfast buffet, but that was only issue.
user_name:
Ronald M K
Chicago, United States

review_body: We booked award travel for this trip and it beyond exceeded my expectations. Our view of the Tokyo tower was insane and the blackout shades were so convenient. The amenities were amazing, lovely personal hot tub and a gorgeous spa/pool area. Negative reviewers are literally some of the most pretentious people, so seriously just enjoy yourself and bask in a five-star experience. There's wine/highballs during happy hour, a nice snack spread basically all the time, and a wonderful staff who all speak English! Thank you so much, Andaz. Hope to return again :)

Rooftop bar in Andaz Tokyo definitely assists me with a great service, especially Mr. Hyogo I must say as well. :) Every visits I made, each time he has been very kind and professional. Furthermore, i think he speaks quite an English which makes me very comfortable. I’m always happy to see people who provides such a great service with also a great energy like he has!

The hotel is gorgeous and caters well to both business and family. We were there with both. The only drawback is that there are not a lot of places to eat within a short walk of the hotel, and a lot of places open late in the morning. The pool is gorgeous and is mainly for lap swimming. There is a slightly wider section that my older son practiced swimming in, but in general, the pool is for lap swimming. The water temperature and the room itself was very nice and enjoyable. There were two hot tubs that had cool bubbles that stuck to the floor in your footprint.

I want to move in. This was a perfect hotel for someone who has just arrived in Tokyo. The design is sleek and well organized and the services were bar none. The amenities exceeded expectations even for Asia!

I cannot comment about the hotel room as I was not staying there. I visited the bar and tea room at the top floor and it was great for a business meeting. We were welcomed and well served, had enough coffee and snacks, not to mention the beautiful view on Tokyo skyline!Recommended

Stayed here for two nights this time, tokyo tower view room is always stunning. Service from the front desk staffs were as attentive as in my previous stay.Enjoyed the great breakfast spread and in room dining. Hotel also offers cocktail hours at lobby every night which offers good selection of cheeses and canapes.Very great stay and I am impressed with the consistency of top quality service over the last few years.Highly recommended!

I stay here about 6-8 days every month for a good reason. It’s a home away from home for me. You’ll get what you expect from a luxury hotel. Staff are nice. Service is excellent, and the rooms are always in the same excellent condition

Our young family stayed at the Andaz Tokyo for a few days in May, and we loved it.The decor is beautiful with lots of wood and stone. The paper art in the lift was so intricate. The view was amazing, with our 50th floor room looking towards the Imperial Gardens and Tokyo Skytree. The hotel lobby is on the 51st floor with views in each direction, including the Tokyo Tower. Each day snacks and drinks were placed in the lobby for guests to enjoy. The offerings were rotated based on the time of day. Checking in is informal with guests asked to take a seat whilst staff take care of the check in. The room was very clean and so spacious. The entry /closet area of the room has great storage. The bathroom is a wet room with shower and large sunken bath. The toilet is in a seperate room and features a Japanese style electric toilet. As we were travelling with a young child and a baby, cute tiger themed items were provided for our children. A full size cot was also provided on request with baby amenities, including a nappy/diaper bin in the bathroom. Housekeeping was excellent and replenished towels regularly. Dinner at the Tavern was just perfection. Expensive but the food is delicious. The children’s bento meal provided to our daughter was fantastic. She enjoyed the attention and pampering from the staff. Overall the staff were great and provided excellent service. Concierge arranged a transfer to our next destination and it was all taken care of.Cost of the hotel is on the higher end, however you get what you pay for with the service and luxurious surroundings. We’d happily stay with Andaz Tokyo on our next visit. Thanks for the great stay

This hotel is amazing - a must see in the city. We lucked out that our architect told us to check it out and it was no joke. i am staying here next time! one of the highest views in the city, the food is over flowing, mixology was fun and unique. Just the entire atmosphere is different - from the entry up to the lobby level, then the meandering rooms to sit, explore, check-in, or have a private meeting with the concierge. The kitchen and restaurant area is so alive! The roof top has a super cool bar and sushi spot - it was closed when we arrived, but they made a special opening for us just to view the living wall. Imagine the service - to bring a guest to a secure rooftop level when everything is closed, then open it all up, so we can experience the space. That is service and an understanding of people, a genuine desire to find a way to meet any need no matter the strange request. Bravo!

One of the striking differences that sets this hotel apart is the check-in experience. Instead of standing behind a desk, you are escorted to sit down at a table and offered a beverage. Such a comfortable check-in process! The staff here is exceptionally warm and welcoming especially Miri from Front Desk. There were a total of 3 of us and they provided a free rollaway bed (most hotels would charge for this). The mattress was a bit too firm for my liking, but sheets and goose down pillows were soft and sufficient. Beverages in the mini-fridge and snacks are complimentary and re-stocked with a room makeup. Gym access is 24 hours and well-maintained with excellent equipment. Surrounding area is very quiet and not bustling with traffic. Great for a little respite from the typical Tokyo hustle and bustle.I stayed at the Ritz Carlton Tokyo and Conrad Tokyo, both of which are priced higher, and yet I would still choose Andaz Tokyo when I return!

Our family enjoyed our stay here. Rooms are clean and compact with modern and stylish bathrooms. The metro is a 5 min walk, but not a hub, so usually will need to transfer to go to tourist areas. Cocktail hour is appreciated. Costly, but worth $

We have stayed at this hotel 3 years in a row . Every-time we debate on weather we should try a new hotel but we just love it so much that we always end up staying there . I think it has the best view of Tokyo since all the rooms are above the 47th floor. The hotel looks brand new and everything is beautiful. The room service food and hotel restaurant food is great and the service is just great . They go above and beyond to accommodate .

This was my first stay at the Andaz Tokyo. Three hotel is well located, very clean and the gym was the best I have experienced in a hotel in Tokyo. Afternoon happy hour is a very nice touch when returning to the hotel. I will certainly return.

This was my third stay at an Andaz in Asia (after Shanghai and Singapore) and I’m a big fan of the brand.Overall we had a great experience in Tokyo. Rooms are the best I’ve experienced so far in an Andaz but on balance I prefer the common area in Shanghai.Check in was efficient and friendly. My Explorist status was recognised and we were upgraded to a Tower View room (even though I’d used points).Our room was spacious and I loved the huge sofa. I also appreciated the super soft, high-quality bed linen. After a few years, though, rooms are beginning to show a little wear and tear (eg the carpet).Evening drinks are served from 6-8 in the lounge, next to the lobby. I felt this was quite a strange space. People are constantly coming and going and there isn’t much natural light. The canapés were OK, but nothing to write home about. My wife loved the local ‘yuzu’ wine but I felt the red wine was average. The lounge also serves a simple breakfast of coffee, pastries, rice balls and fruit.I think the staff at this hotel are doing a great job. Every interaction was positive and I felt valued as a guest. Well done guys!My main issue with this hotel is the price. Yes it’s Tokyo, but the rack rate when we stayed was well over $1000 USD a night. Breakfast, after tax, is ¥5,000. That’s crazy money.

This was our second time staying at the hotel (2018 and 2019). We came back because of the staff and how sweet they were to my daughter. They did not disappoint the second time around. My daughter looked forward to saying hi to the "ladies" each morning. They got to know her, made her feel at home, and took time to ask her about her day. We ended up extending our stay at the hotel (instead of moving to another as planned), because of how at home we felt.

Fabulous location. Wonderful building with many restaurants and areas to explore on the property. Close to train station. Great experience. Staff is VERY helpful. Our son was sick while visiting and they were able to help us get him to an English speaking clinic nearby.

It was quite expensive, but the value is so high that we found it totally worth it. Everyone we met was super helpful and friendly. The attention to details is impeccable. The room itself is spacious for Tokyo standards as well. The view was wonderful, although we didn’t opt for the Tokyo tower view option. We will definitely select to stay here again.

Highly recommended. Location of the hotel is perfect, the rooms and bathrooms are big with a magnificent view. The breakfasts are the best in Tokyo, a wide range of food, fruits and beverages. Besides, at 17-00 near the reception you can always find a table with different fruites, canapes and vines for free.

A fantastic hotel with great facilities, staff and location. A must if visiting Tokyo!! Great for families and the buffet breakfast is exquisite. The rooftop bar is perfect with amazing views across the city skyline.

Excellent hotel ,but the price is not worth the aggravation from svc staff in the cafe and or restaurants. Overall the pool and room is excellent but the extra fees end up on average $800 Usa $$$ per night.

Staying at the Andaz was one of the best decisions we made during our trip to Japan. Beautiful design, very comfortable and spacious room, lovely amenities, and super-helpful staff. And those views...!

Hotel was nice and new, beautiful interior with great services. Although I find that the price rate was a little too high, but totally worth staying at. The location of the hotel is around 15minutes walk to Ginza and 20minutes walk to Tokyo station

We booked our room through Amex and found the quality of the room and the price weren't in line. The hotel is quite nice, a little out of the way from the busy areas, but for us that was a plus. We arrived in the lobby and the check-in was quick. The front desk person said they were giving us an upgrade from a Park View to the Bay view. To be honest, we were so tired from the flight, I didn't make a fuss, since I thought the upgrade would be great. I was disappointed to find us in a room that had seen better days. The rug was stained and the wood work in the room was beaten up. We were only staying in the hotel for three nights and were spending most of our days out and about. The tub was great, the amenities (soaps, robes, slippers) were all great and up to par. Bed was comfy. We were there during Cherry Blossom and it's was mankai in Tokyo. The park view with an upgraded room would have been the way for the hotel to give us a perk. We felt a bit cheated. I wish hotels would start treating full paying customers who will come back time and time again with some care. In the final analysis, we would not come back to the hotel.

This hotel is amazing in many ways. Beautiful interior, the rooms have everything you need and the bathroom is to die for. The service at the hotel is excellent. So why not a 10 out of 10?The breakfast! I was so disappointed as I expected so much more just because everything else is perfect. But the breakfast buffet was small and was not only too Japanese it contained strange food that is not breakfast food according to me. No pancakes, waffles or a big selection of bread. You could order omelet but not customer make them. All in all a huge disappointment.

We had a fantastic experience overall with Andaz, the views, the rooms, the service, food, rooftop bar etc.. Everything was amazing. It was a little away from the local metro, but taxi service was right below. Great location, and a very clean and quite space.

Amazing property with beautiful interiors and a good locationservice is quite friendly and efficientonly downside was that the concierge was not willing to give any assistance or guidance for our trip outside of Tokyo. we were travelling to Kyoto right after, and they said that unless we were guests at the property on those dates, they are not willing to help us.

This was our first stop in Japan on a 2 week tour with family to see the wonderfully Sakura blossoms.We upgraded our rooms to a corner, and I would strongly recommend anyone to do the same - the views across the city are just amazing, so much so we slept with our curtains open.The room, bathroom and storage was just like having a mini apartment in Tokyo - fantastic for 2 people.A surprising welcome was the addition of a ‘lounge’ area facility downstairs in the reception lobby where you could help yourself to hot drinks and soft drinks, along with sweeties and nibbles. A very nice and welcomed touch.Downstairs to the hotel block is a whole array of restaurants to tempt, along with shops to stock up on snacks.All in all we had a wonderful few days here and I would definitely recommend this as a fantastic place to stop with service to match.

This luxurious hotel occupies the top 6 floors of the new Mori Tower at Toranomon Hills, near Shimbashi and Roppongi . Beautiful rooms with spacious, textured-granite bathrooms and walnut paneling with spectacular views of the city . The Andaz Tavern on 51st floor is great for breakfast buffet(Japanese/Western hybrid) or meals throughout the day, and featured a live jazz ensemble . A hotel guest lounge nearby offers wines and cruditees for 'happy hour . An outstanding sushi bar on 52, affords personalized service from sushi chefs . Finally, service from front desk is extremely responsive and helpful for people wanting to tour the city and experience restaurants, galleries, etc. Highly recommend !

Fun Hotel situated in the top 8 floors of an office building. Fabulous views, great staff, and well designed, spacious rooms. Fitness center/Spa is one of the best I have experienced in a hotel. The location is OK not great but not an issue.

Pros:- The ambience and design of the hotel are trendy, minimalist and inviting- Room and bathroom are clean, spacious, well designed- Gym is large with a great view but see note below- Free breakfast and snack table at lobby that's a hit with kids especially (donuts, pastries, juices for breakfast, candies, chocolates, tea for the res of the day for example)Cons:- Check in was very slow (over 30 minutes)- Gym's treadmill machines were very close to one another that when the person next to me ran, my machine vibrated along with his rhythm- Service at street level lobby was very disappointing. A young woman who was stationed there was just smirking when we went to the wrong entrance and did not point to the right direction, till another younf man pointed us to the right direction. She knew we were guests cause a few hours earlier she was the one who stood over (and did not help) when we arrived for check in.- Location is quite a distance from the nearest train station, a problem for us one evenimg when it was raining.Probably would not come back here.

Amazing service & beautiful rooms. The Tokyo Tower views were breathtaking! Had lunch at the restaurant and it was delicious, same with the breakfast. All in all a perfect stay at a beautiful hotel and super friendly staff!

luxurious feel for the rooms/ sauna/ swimming poolbuffet breakfast good but could do with more variety/ international cuisinefriendly staff but more attention to detail is warranted- aware trip was for wedding anniversary celebration but was given single bed room even though booking was done 6 weeks in advance

I had a fabulous time at the Andaz Tokyo Toranomon Hills! Staff was super efficient and helpful. Checkin/checkout was seamless, rooms were spacious and clean with amazing views of Tokyo Tower! There was free snacks and beverages available throughout the day it was easy to get to Ginza from my hotel, just 5 mins taxi ride. I had a perfect stay at Andaz. Will definitely recommend this place to my close friends. And look forward to my next stay here!
user_name:
Jaipersaud B
New York City, New York

review_body: Our stay at the Andaz was lovely - the property was gorgeous, food was great, and the staff was so helpful. The hotel is located pretty close to some subway stops, making it fairly easy to get around, and there is a lovely shrine two blocks away that you can visit at your leisure (it has a ton of steps to reach it, so be aware that it involves climbing). Would absolutely stay again!

I recently stayed at the Andaz Tokyo for 3 nights. I was most impressed and delighted with the hotel and the staff. Previously, I have stayed at the more well known Park Hyatt which is lovely but, for me, the Andaz provides the same experience with less formality. I introduced myself to the executive chef, Shaun Keenan, to thank him and his staff foe the delicious food and wonderful, attentive service. He was most gracious and thoughtful. He suggested we eat at the hotel's sushi restaurant and made reservation on a busy Saturday night with the head sushi chef, Toshihiro Watanabe, who was outstanding with his service and 5-star sushi. The experience was a little slice of heaven.The entire Andaz staff are amazing and professional.

I always try to stay at Andaz hotels whenever possible. Why? Because they are always excellent in terms of service, accommodations, and location. I’m very lucky that Andaz hotels are within walking distance of my offices in both Tokyo and London so it’s a no-brainer for me. This was my first stay at the Tokyo Andaz and it did not disappoint. The room was quite spacious and modern. More importantly, the staff were very friendly and reliable. The free happy hour in the check-in area was a nice touch. The rooftop bar is not to be missed. I did not eat at any of the restaurants but the room service breakfast was very good. The view from my room was an excellent one of the Tokyo Tower.
user_name:
wint2013
New York City, New York

review_body: Hotel is nice and quiet. Two steps lift room access is not a problem at all, as they are super fast! Will definitely be back here next time in Tokyo. Hotel's bakery shop on ground level is a must try!

This was my first stay here. I’ve been trying the Andaz product out in various locations one leisure travel, so thought I’d give this one a try. Usually I stay at the Roppongi Ritz Carlton, but it’s getting a little worn down. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the hotel is located between floors 45 and 51 in the building; high above street noise.Our room had all the right amenities, and incredible city-scape views. Housekeeping was prompt and thorough, as was laundry service (pickup and delivery).We enjoyed the buffet breakfast each morning (three night stay), and had a drink in the bar-area the other night (the Jazz musicians were fantastic!).While the hotel isn’t luxury, it’s clean, nice, well appointed, and has a wonderful staff. Very functional place if you’re planning on being out and about touring the city.

Surrounded by a big family who cares and smiles, laugh and enjoy with you. Every staff come and talk to you and cares about your stay and wants to make you happy and satisfied. Happy hour is heavenly.

I visited the Andaz for a 4-day business trip, and found it to be an excellent home base: well-located for my meetings (although I don't know if I would have liked it as much if tourism was my goal). The hotel and rooms are tranquil, the views spectacular, and the staff was polite and helpful at every turn.
