review_body: I chose Andaz Tokyo because of its proximity to Chiyoda Ku. And was surprised to see how beautifully the hotel has been put together. From the ground level reception to the rooms at 47-50 floors and two story ceiling at the reception and the rooftop bar and the two story high ceiling of spa makes it a lavishly appointed hotel. For an average of $1000 a night with about 25% taxes added, it's still a place worth experiencing..
user_name:
satishjchatham
Washington Dc, District Of Columbia

review_body: Ideally located south of the imperial gardens, andaz tokyo reflects everything you expect from good japanese hospitality.Excellent but not spacious rooms with top of the line bathroom, very attentive and dedicated staff to make you feel at home.If you like walking, you are really well located to walk to the imperial gardens, the shiodome area and many other places.In the evening or in the morning, you can work your body or relax in the small but very nice pool.Last but not least, a fascinating decoration...

Everything about the hotel is magnificent. It would be perfect, if the hotel adds a menu for the kids - a pizza served by room service would be great. Proximity to underground stations, and convenient stores adds to the value of your stay.

I was there for 4 days with my family, very nice hotel,modern design with professional team management. We have breakfast and lunch in the hotel ,the service was good and the manger come to talk with us to introduce the city.For sure i will be back

From the cab rank (ground floor) to the reception desk (51st floor) in one ear-popping elevator ride, to a warm wellcome in the lobby. Then: a few floors lower (the 48th for me) to the room, which was spacious, well layed out with a double bath and separate shower, a settee and desk, and a view to die for (even Mount Fuji, on clear days). And a toilet for which you need a computer programming course, but that's Standard- in Japan.The building (Toranomon Hills Mori Tower) houses many restaurants and a shopping mall, offices (including the Tokyo 2020 Olympics Organisation) and apartments, plus the hotel, which uses the top six floors. All the rooms are built around a hollow core, which houses the elevator shafts and emergency exits: the building is supposed to be earthquake-proofAt present, the direct area on the noth side of the hotel is one big building lot: a new metro line and offices are being constructed, but as this is done the Japanese way, there is hardly any inconvenience (safety inspectors are standing on top of safety inspectors).The surrounding area is quiet and well laid out: nearby are some very nice temples- especially the Zojo-Ji temple, which showed the first Spring Blossom while I visited. The Japanese there went mental, and couldn't stop taking photographs. Tokyo Station and the Imperial Gardens are also within walking distance.Secret tip: a few Streets to the north there is an Izakaya (small bar/restaurant) named Hans. I's a great little place to have a bite, and get drunk with the salarymen (office workers) on a Friday night- meet the Japanese with their guard down.... Tell the woman owner the guy from Amsterdam sent you.

The views from the lobby and rooms are breathtaking. The service was outstanding, we arrived at around lunch time and they offered us food and tea. Lunch at the hotel restaurants was excellent and the Japanese breakfast delicious. They also offer a regular breakfast buffet, which was excellent. Great experience in Tokyo.
user_name:
Z Z
New York City, New York

review_body: We arrived early after an overnight flight and the lovely staff accommodated us and got us into a room quickly. It was our 2nd visit there and it was equally as amazing as our first stay. We traveled with our 3yo son. The hotel room had amazing views of Tokyo Tower, the gym is well equipped and we enjoyed the evening drinks provided. Our son had a great time running around the adjacent park. We ate at the bar/resto and our son's kids meal was beautifully presented. The hotel is slightly off the beaten path but we didn't mind. Toranamon coffee in the nearby shopping center is a must go to!

The hotel is located on several of the higher floors of a large high-rise. Our room had a great view and was very comfortable and clean with great amenities including complimentary non-alcoholic drinks and snacks. And the large, well-appointed bathroom was great.The location is not very convenient if you are looking to tour multiple areas of Tokyo, so you may want to stay closer to Tokyo Station or be okay with multiple train transfers from the subway stations.Staff was friendly and helpful. They helped us book the Airport Limousine bus to Narita which was really convenient and picked up right in front of the hotel.

Two things that stood out to me is the service and the food available to the guests. Been here several times and every time the staff at this hotel has remembered my preferences and accommodated accordingly. Far beyond a lot of hotels do. The snacks at check in and check out is a nice touch that lasts. Comfort - 5 Rooms are clean and modern. A little smaller than some of the other higher end hotels but the bathroom is on point. Location - 4You can get most everything you want in the Toranomon Hills building but a little off the beaten path of the hustle and bustle. Misc - 5As mentioned, food is the way to my heart. The buffet breakfast is one of the better ones I've encountered. Has a great mix of western and Japanese choices. Will be back!

I have stayed at hotels all over the world, and across the US, Europe, Middle East and Asia, and I would have to stay, hands down, the Andaz Tokyo at Toranomon Hills would have to be one of the top three best hotels I have ever stayed in. From the moment you step out of your taxi and check in, and walk through the corridors of this beautiful hotel, it's inimitable panache, to the gorgeous room and views of Tokyo. Nothing compares, to the sheer brilliance and magnificence of this property. It is an eye-opener, and jaw-dropper. Stay here, and be prepared to amaze yourself at a hotel that truly impresses.

Anyone who's been to a hotel in Japan knows that service in any hotel or restaurant will surpass expectations. The Andaz does that with metropolitan grandeur and flair. All rooms have magnificent views due to their being on the top floors of a 50 floor tower. All rooms are up to date and include a small bose sound system that can link to your phone via bluetooth. Thus you can enjoy a great room while listening to your personal play lists.

You won't go wrong staying at the Andaz. The view from the rooms are great. There's access to a great gym along with a very nice pool area. It's also surrounded by several restaurants along with the Ginza subway stop which is 2 blocks away.

Nice hotel , with nice view from the room and new , breakfast area are very nice view also and good food quality .Easy to go everywhere in Tokyo from this hotel .Really nice place to stay in Tokyo .Will come back

This was my favorite hotel experience to date. The Andaz is located at the top of the Toranomon Hills building and you have to take the initial elevators all the way up to the hotel lobby, then take a separate set of elevators down to the actual floors. The lobby and rooms have a healthy amount of wood accents that look amazing. The rooms are decorated with the typical Japanese aesthetic that although appears simple, works very well with the overall theme. Non-alcoholic items in the minibar are complimentary. The bathroom has a nice set-up with a beautiful circular tub, and rainfall shower. Free slippers and yukata are provided, as well. The hotel is a little distance away from subway and JR lines, but the area was nice and quiet and we didn't mind the 10-15 minute walks to public transportation.

We went for afternoon tea at the Andaz Tokyo Toranomon Hills.Finding the way into the hotel was not that easy as it was poorly signposted. We came in from the street, having walked from Shimbashi Station. We had to ask for directions and needed to go down to the parking levels in order to access a lift that would take us up to the correct floor. It was worth finding.There was a selection of teas, coffees and herbal brews included in the price, with refills included for the whole three hours. I tried the wild cherry, the rosehip and hibiscus, and green tea. Every cup was freshly made when ordered.The selection of foods was excellent, we both went for the option that included both savoury and sweet items, rather than sweet only. The flavours were delicious and included some unusual combinations. I am fussy about my scones, so to me they were too sweet and the texture was too dense. I also like them served warm. However, they were perfectly edible and we were brought extra jam and cream on request.The service was excellent: attentive without being intrusive in any way.This is not a cheap way to spend the afternoon, but it was a delicious special treat.

We spent our last night in Tokyo at the Andaz. From the second we arrived in the lobby, I thought "this is what it's like to be a celebrity". The level of attention and help from the staff is superb. No waiting in line to check in. Instead you have a seat in a lovely lounge and drink and snack while waiting for your key. The rooms are gorgeous with incredible views. The perfect combination of modern and comfort. The gym is large and very well appointed and the pool is INSANE. Of course, there are multiple jacuzzis and a sauna for your enjoyment.Food is a bit spendy, but well worth it for the quality and atmosphere. The breakfast buffet is in my top 5 of all time.Even though it was pouring rain our last 2 days in Tokyo, we didn't mind since were able to rest, relax, and enjoy this amazing hotel.

My husband and I stayed at the Andaz for 3 nights for a mini-getaway. This place is perfect for both business and leisure. The standard room was huge for Japanese standard! It was comparable to a upscale hotel room in Bangkok, totally unexpected! Brand new amenities and great view of the Tokyo Tower from the lobby. I made used of the gym and pool everyday, the equipment was new and they provided complimentary bottled water in the gym, which were much needed! Didn't get a chance to try the food at the hotel, as there are so many great eateries in Tokyo. The staff was also very helpful in helping to ship a late package of ours to another address. The only minor complaint is that this hotel is not located right on top of a subway stop. It was a close 5-min walk to 3 different stops, not a problem for adults at all, but if I travelled with little kids, I would have chose another more centrally located hotel.

Sharka
New York City, New York

review_body: My partner and I are high-end hotel junkies and frequent travelers to Japan. On our most recent trip in March, we experimented with a luxury hotel trifecta: started with two nights at the Aman, spent a few days at the Andaz using Hyatt points, and finished at the Park Hyatt Tokyo. Let's start with the positives at the Andaz: we stayed in a room on the 50th floor, and the view was absolutely sensational. It's especially incredible in the evening, when all of the surrounding buildings are aglow. In many ways the Andaz offers better views than the premium rooms at the PH; on a clear day, we could glimpse Fuji *and* the dramatic cityscape (whereas at the PH, you're often choosing between Fuji views or views of Yoyogi/Shinjuku). Moving around the city was a cinch thanks to the hotel's proximity to the subway stations at Kamiyacho (gotta love that Hibiya line) and Toranomon. The surrounding area has fairly diverse and reasonably priced dining options, from an old-school soba joint to cheap curry rice to coffee places with surly hipster baristas- though you have to go outside the nabe to find Tokyo's exceptional restaurants. Staff are generally warm and attentive, holding elevator doors if they see you coming and offering tins of candy upon check-out. The OK: We had a few requests of the "host" staff while we were there, ranging from dinner and cocktail reservations to a gift. They did a terrific job of speedily arranging "White Day" flowers and chocolates for us, and the staff member who checked us in kindly offered to take a photo of us to celebrate (a nice and unexpected touch). They were less adept and efficient when it came to food recs and reservations- we wound up handling most of those arrangements ourselves. Now the not-so-good: I arrived under the impression that the hotel would be well-designed. While the hotel common spaces are comfortable and chic, the guest rooms are unspeakably ugly. Because we were using points, we had a standard king room, and it felt cramped. The beautiful views are marred by clunky, awkwardly placed furniture; the bathroom layout is odd; and let's not even talk about that abomination of a chartreuse rug. I was also surprised to see that while the hotel is fairly new, our room looked a bit worse for the wear; lots of scuff marks and dents in the white walls and faint stains on the carpet. The hotel buffet breakfast is expensive and full of insufferable American businessmen in suits who talk on their cellphones at the tables and strut around self-importantly. Skip it and go eat at one of the local cafes.We'd definitely use points again at the Andaz; not sure if we'd actually shell out $$$ for a room there. Perhaps the higher room categories offer more space and better design.
user_name:
ValeP36
Long Island City, New York

review_body: A wonderful hotel, from the check in experience to gorgeous pool and spa. The bar has live music every night - jazz types - and there are also lots of other restaurants and cafes in the same building if you don't want to eat at the hotel. We ate in the bar and restaurant- both very good. We also went to the roof top bar - a bit chilly in March even with the heated blankets provided, but an amazing view.Good location and the staff are really helpful- from writing out our destinations in Japanese for the taxi drivers, and we also went to the Blue Note to listen to some live jazz, and they organised the booking for us. You can get the airport limousine bus direct from the airport to the hotel also.

Wonderful Hotel. Stay here, especially if debating the Park Hyatt. We read a lot about both hotels battling for the best Tokyo hotel (or at least the best Hyatt brand hotel) and without doubt Andaz wins. Will definitely return. Absolute modern luxury with great services and staff. Hotel is located in Toranomon Hills which is the base for the 2020 olympics so the area will only improve. Not much going on right at the hotel (Mori Tower) which is actually pleasant in Tokyo, when the rest of the day is spent battling crowds and wishing you brought your own face mask too! The tower is about 5-8min from Toranomon station on Ginza line (need pasmo or suica) and 10-14min from Shimbashi station on JR yamanote line (free with JR pass). Close to imperial palace and ginza too. The area isnt all that crowded compared to shinjuku or shibuya and shimbashi itself was a fun area (seems like where the salary men go to play)Once you enter the tower everything is serene and its easy to get to the hotel lobby on 51st floor (takes only 44sec)The lobby is amazing and the checkin experience sets the tone for the whole stay- super friendly and done over wine and snacks, before going down another set of elevators to your room. Andaz didn't honour the room upgrade that comes with tablet membership but it didn't matter because the baseroom was simply stunning. So modern, large, well appointed- and made more so with sleek floor to ceiling windows and auto blinds, and complimentary minibar (non alcoholic) and snacks. There is a different feel to the hotel room when you can open the fridge and grab a drink and snack without having to spend 20bucks for it at checkout. Wonderful day and night view of Tokyo tower and the sprawling city. The room layout is perfect and the washroom is the best I've ever used. Most sophisticated Toto i saw in all of japan. A large step in stone/tiled room with multi head shower, and a deep large onsen-like tub which is just wonderful. This respect for water is present throughout the entire hotel especially the pool and gym area. The pool area is so modern with amazing staff. The pool is tight once two people swim laps but never was crowded so this wasn't an issue. The hot tubs are plenty with options of jets, full body aqua massage and carbonated hot tub. It was wonderful to unwind here daily. The changerooms to the pool are amazing themselves. Tons of space, lockers, lounge space with recliner chairs and snacks, and the mens room had a 18deg plunge pool, 42deg hot tub and great sauna. Womens had a 360 shower experience which i was told was amazing and the spa services world class. Breakfast was another major highlight. So many amazing food options, japanese and western style. Attention to detail everywhere- the food, the service, the lounge. Just amazing. And more free snacks and wines everyday at 6pm. I don't know how a hotel could be any better. There is a to-go coffee area where you can make a great coffee as you head out. We are glad we stayed here for five nights and the PH for 1 to check it out but would have wanted to spend all our time here!This is our go to choice for Tokyo. Best hotel. Brief tips for japan:- pocket wifi is a life saver for google maps alone- Pasmo card is useful and worked for subway, cabs in tokyo and kyoto- keep a small towel as some washrooms dont have towels or dryers. - have a good system to handle and make use of all the change you accumulate

I always stay Andaz when I be Tokyo this nearly several times. I like the room face to Tokyo Tower, and it seems just in front of your face. If you turn off all the room light, you will feel the means of "the city of sky". Morden deco, detail of Jaoanese culture, good service, and fabulous breakfast. Love it.

Easily one of the best hotels in Tokyo. Facilities are excellent, room is generously large, bathroom and shower/bath is stunning, views are beautiful, staff is friendly and proactive. Downside is location, but there is a subway station a few minutes away that connects to the rest of Tokyo. Do not walk from station with luggage, rather use a taxi!

I had an amazing stay at Andaz for 1 week business trip. The service was amazing from the moment I got off the taxi, to the relaxing checkin process, and the amazing staff at the pool/gym. The room was very spacious with a spectacular view of the skytree from the 50th floor. The big bathtub was super nice, but I ended up spending my daily soak at the 3 jaccizi pools at the spa. The spa with gym and pools were never crowded and it really helped me recharge from the busy work schedule. They even had 4 massage chairs in a side room in the spa locker room. The location was convenient with many restaurants in the Toranomon Hills building.

Room had amazing rooms, spacious and comfortable. Bathroom is amazing; Spa is super, pool and locker rooms are excellent. Conference rooms were super for our business meeting. Food in the restaurant was excellent, plus the happy hour snacks were delicious.

I have stayed here several times and my recent visits (twice this month) reinforced how much I love this hotel. Staff are incredibly friendly and service oriented, the rooms are beautifully appointed and it's quite an oasis to return to after a day of adventuring in Tokyo. I am already counting down to my next visit. We visited the spa for the first time and it was sublime, I'm disappointed to have missed out on it on prior stays.

Friendly helpful staff in a great location. Clean rooms, nice snacks and drinks available for happy hour. All the staff willing to go the extra mile to ensure a wonderful stay! Highly recommend this hotel!

Located on the high floors (47-52F) and night view of Tokyo Tower is especially superb. Tokyo Sky Tree can be seen underneath. Palace, buildings of Marunouchi can be seen underneath. Hotel staff are polite very kind, which can be evaluated best among other high class hotels in Tokyo.

I've stayed at this property three times now. I live the fact that you are away from major traffic areas and a more relaxed area. Yet on a 7 minute walk away from the subway. Staff are always on hand to help and meet your expectations. I didn't any connecting rooms. Rooms are ample in size and comfortable. Ask for extra pillows if you like better support. Our pillows were somewhat small. Other than that, we loved our stay.

Spend only one night in this incredible hotel. As a hyatt fan, I can't help compare this property with the park hyatt tokyo I stayed last year. I can now totally understand why a category 6 (Andaz) is more popular than a category 7 (park hyatt) one. The hotel uses a modern Japanese design from lobby into each room. very impressive! complementary soft drink and water in the refrigerator, which is definitely a plus. All staffs are hospitable. Really makes you feel like home! and speak fluent English as well. One suggestion. Most travelers really need the concierge to offer receiving package service. i.e. I was planing to order a SIM card online and ship to the hotel before I arrive so that I can have access to the map online in Japan(we all know how complicated the subway stations are). Unfortunately, this property concierge never replies my emails. At last, I have to send my SIM card to the convenient store nearby this hotel. In contrast, during this business trip, I also stay in hilton nagoya for one night, they respond my receiving package request within one day. A nice concierge service can really bring your property to next level. I still remember the warn greeting from park hyatt Tokyo last year. Overall, this is a very nice property of Hyatt. Recommend everyone to take a visit in this luxury hotel!!

We stayed for one night on a return trip back to the US.Great location near the Ginza, Shinjuku, Tokyo Station...Lobby is located on the 51st floor with complimentary beverages.Beautiful views throughout the hotel.Our room was modern, clean, and hi-tech. The small mini bar also has complimentary snacks and non-alcoholic beverages. Service is excellent. One of best I've stayed at in Tokyo...

My Andaz hotel experience was amazing from beg-to-end. Even compared to my usual hotel experiences in Dubai and Abu Dhabi. Definitely recommend this to anyone on the fence, as I was. Yes, Aman may be better, but this hotel was AMAZING.

Besides great view, convenient location, most important is room condition and service. You may be surprised that service aren't always you expected in Japan due culture, language etc; however, Andaz Tokyo just different, from you arriving drop off area (not lobby yet because lobby is on top of the building), warm welcome from the Andaz team. They assist you to the lobby lift. Great service at the reception of course, enjoy a drink from waiting area while waiting to be check in. Excellent room setting, great view and very comfortable real king bed. The bath has a big circle tube, can accommodate two. Not marble, great warm feeling of wood bath room. Of course, shower area is stone. I have stayed over 300 hotels in past years but this is the best in Japan. If you demand quality and style, this's it.This is my second stay at Andaz Tokyo, after trying all other brands of Hyatt group in Japan, i will of course come back again.

review_body: A very very beautiful hotel in Tokyo. Nice bedrooms, super nice bathrooms. Restaurants, bars everything is really ++. Service is perfect. My only comment would be on the hotel set up - having to use different elevators to reach the lobby then rooms is sometimes annoying. But honestly go without any question!

Stayed at the 50th floor overviewing Tokyo Tower. The view is breathtaking, you can even see Mount Fuji behind Roppongi HIlls.The hotels is brand new and stylish, everything works and is in top condition. Rooms are spacious, big compared to Tokyo standards and very well designed.Non alcoholic drinks and snacks from the minibar are complimentary. Internet is free and quick.Lots of restaurants, cafeterias and bars in the same building complex but never felt crowded like Roppongi Hills or Midtown. There’s also a very nice convenience store in the 2nd floor.Decor is nice, modern, zen feeling, recommended 100%.

Context:To provide some background, this is my 12th or so trip to Japan. On this trip I used Chase/Hyatt points to stay at the three Hyatt locations in Tokyo: Hyatt Regency Tokyo, Tokyo Park Hyatt, and the Andaz Toranomon Hyatt.Transportation:On this most recent stay I actually used the Airport Limousine (shuttle bus) service from Narita Airport to the Hyatt Regency in Shinjuku. However, the service also takes you directly from Narita (3100 yen/approx $31 US) or Haneda (1130 yen/approx $11 US) to the Andaz. Since the last portion of our trip was at the Andaz, we booked the shuttle in the opposite direction to Narita at the bell counter on the first floor. It's very convenient as they will book the charges directly to your room. You then settle the charges on your credit card when you check out. You can also use alternate means of transportation such as the train, but on recent trips, I decided that the airport limousine (shuttle bus) is easier since you don't have to worry about lugging around heavy luggage through train stations.A quick note on the Airport Limousine service - I normally find that it takes 1 hour and 40 minutes or so from Narita Airport into Tokyo. On this most recent trip there was a traffic accident, so our ride into Tokyo was over 2 hours long. Location:Of the three hotels we stayed at on this trip, I felt that the Andaz equally as convenient as the Hyatt Regency. The Hyatt Regency was nice because the underground walkway to the subway and a 24 hour 7-11 was connected to the hotel. The Andaz on the other hand was a 5 to 10 minute walk from the Toranomon Station on the Tokyo Metro's Ginza Line. Additionally, since the Andaz is located on the top of an office building, there are numerous restaurants and a convenience store located inside of the hotel. We found this to be tremendously useful on the first night of our check in. On that first night, the weather turned ominous with high winds and rain. Rather than chance it out on the streets, we were able to have a delicious meal without stepping out in the elements. When we were done with dinner, we were able to stop at the convenience store and head back to our room, all without leaving the safety and dryness of the building.Hotel:Finding the entrance to the hotel can be a little bit tricky. If you enter the building from the 2nd floor, you'll need to eventually make your way down to the 1st floor to the Andaz elevators. You'll need to catch the express elevator up to the 51st floor and when you exit, you'll eventually come across the area where the reception desk is. The staff was tremendously warm and welcoming. One staff member rushed over to grab our suitcases and offered us a seat in the guest lounge. As we checked in (still seated) we were offered refreshments, so we opted for tea. Once checked in, the reception staff asked to show us our room. At that point we were led from the 51st floor to our room on the 49th floor. The staff then did a quick run through of the complimentary items in the room as well as some of the key features. This was all very nice.As for the room, it was large, modern in design, and upon first impression appeared to be a better value than the Park Hyatt. Here we have a Category 6 Andaz vs a Category 7 Park Hyatt - which on first impression as I mentioned - looked far more elegant and provided a more open feel. The large floor to ceiling glass windows behind a wall to wall couch was an extremely nice touch. The flow of the bathroom to closet was well thought out and allowed you to segregate the area via a hidden door. Alternatively, you could leave the door open for that open feeling. The bath area was exceptional. The shower stall was in the same glass enclosed room as the tub which meant that you could take a shower, and step into the tub without walking out into the cold air. So why did I say that this seemed like a better value on first impression? Well, there were a few things about the room that detracted from the overall experience. First, I had an issue with the smell emanating from the toilet. Just like the Park Hyatt, the toilet is enclosed in its own little stall that can closed off from the rest of the bathroom. The toilet itself had a funky/sour/spoiled smell to it. I've smelled this before from time to time in the restrooms here at work. It's almost as if the cleaners used old cleaner, or recycled cleaner from numerous other cleanings. Whatever the case, the smell made me feel as though the bathroom as dirty. I didn't feel like I was in my own private bathroom, rather I felt as though I was in a public restroom. It's amazing really, how smell could make a room that looks immaculate in appearance "feel" dirty. Second, while extremely modern and flashy, I found the faucet in the bathroom the most impractical to use as compared to the other two Hyatts on this stay. The knobs were probably the diameter of a half dollar or smaller and were difficult to operate. I prefer traditional sized larger knobs. Third, the Nespresso and the blow dryer in the room were broken. The Nespresso would either push through too much water on one instance. On another we had to keep restarting the process to squeeze out enough water to create the desired amount of coffee. The hair dryer's heating coils would not fire on, so my wife was left with cold air coming out of her hair dryer. We were in a rush, so rather than call in for a new one, my wife stepped out of the room with damp hair. While all three of these are minor quibbles, you really wouldn't expect the bad smell or broken items in a room that costs so much. After all, the Park Hyatt and the Hyatt Regency all smelled great - The Hyatt Regency being significantly cheaper.The Bottom Line:Minor quibbles aside (most could be solved with a quick phone call), I think this was an amazing hotel. The service in my opinion was on par or equally as good with The Park Hyatt. I also feel that the modern design and quality of the rooms will blow most people's minds.

I was able to spend elegant time at the best location. Although I used it in the proposal, I appreciate the warm response of the staff. The gym and pool are also on the higher floors and the location is the best. You can also have a good sense of reasonable distance hospitality.

I highly appreciate the friendly staffs of Andaz. I think the pool, the gym and the spa are the most substantial among hotels in Tokyo. The comfort of the room and the bed comfort are perfect. Buffet breakfast is one of the fun of every time. I would definitely stay Andaz again.

Andaz Tokyo is simply tremendous. The service, quality of accommodations, friendly staff, view, atmosphere, balance of modern and traditional Japanese culture and overall value is outstanding. If you are going to Tokyo for your first time or returning there isn't a better place to stay. Positioned perfectly. Close to everything you want and need. I can't say enough good things about this hotel!!!

Excellent hotel, the best service, all the staff are good, the room is clean and big (50 sq. m), housekeeping did a good job, never miss an item everyday, the rooms starts from 40th floor, stunning view from the room no matter which side is facing, mini bar are complimentary (except the wines), very generous. Will only stay at the Andaz Tokyo if I visit Tokyo again.

Stayed during a business trip. The rooms are very well appointed. They have most of the items that you would randomly forget. The automatic black-out shades are crucial when the sun comes up at 3:45am. The indoor pool is massive with a great view. Every night they have happy hour with complementary wine and snacks. We would usually meet and have a drink in the lounge before dinner. The hotel shares the building with a few restaurants and a good coffee shop. My only complaint is that check-in seemed to take forever on a not very busy afternoon. All-in-all a great stay.

best in class hotel with the bext view in Tokyo, you're not lost in translation but lost in the air for the best dreams ever! design and quiet hotel just like being at home but on the 51st floor. The gym/spa is also as perfect as the quality of service.

The view from the bar is truly superb, both by day and night and well worth the high prices that you have to pay here for food and drink.All the hotel staff are friendly and efficient and will always attempt to help. They all seem to speak English very well also.The quality of food is excellent and every where is spotlessly clean.Slightly confusing route to reception/lobby though.Fully deserving of the 5 stars.

If you want a nice skyline view room of Tokyo, try this to quite new Andaz Tokyo totanomon hills location under hyatt brand. Room is nice and facility is good and love their service. Room is spacious compared to Tokyo standard and for a regular room is over 400sq feet and I think it is better than lot of cities . Also, mini bar inclusive rate is quite a good hospitality item from Andaz group. It is just a bit far for walking distance to the subway station though (10-15mins) and around the area, it may not easy to find any restaurants or shops, unlike other area like Shinjuku or Tokyo station.

This is a wonderful hotel, one of the best I have stayed in. The health's club and facilities were outstanding. All in all it is a hotel that I would highly recommend whether on business or a vacation.

We had a lovely, restful stay at the Andaz in Toronamon Hills in Tokyo. The room was lovely, the service impeccable and the facilities (pool, spa and restaurants) perfect. The décor of the rooms is very stylish and modern, and the view is spectacular. Highly recommended.

An excellent hotel in a very convenient loacation in downtown Tokyo. Superior hotel facilty and room. Responsive and sincere staff committed to quality service. Room service available at odd hours when international travelers need it.

Had a smashingly awesome time. Staff were efficient and always courteous to my requests. Very attentive and highly recommended. Convenience is epic and everything from eateries, taxi to subway is walking steps away

Gorgeous modern hotel, very slick. Great staff, all English-speaking, excellent level of service. My room was big and beautiful, with a fantastic view from the 48th floor of the building. I didn't use them but the hotel also had a pool and gym + spa.

The Andaz in Toranomon Hills is a beautiful, modern, if spare hotel on the top six floors of one of the highest towers in Tokyo. The rooms are beautifully appointed, well designed and quite large. We stayed in a room overlooking Tokyo Tower and were treated to a view of Mt Fuji on a wonderfully clear winter morning. The lobby floor and the rooftop sushi bar all have fantastic views over the entire city. A couple of additional tips for first time travelers:1) there are multiple ways of getting to the hotel from Narita, all of them over an hour. We deemed a car/taxi as too expensive and caught a limousine bus in which worked great for luggage. We took the N'Ex (Narita Express) back to the airport and, while comfortable, it was a bit of a slog with stairs and escalators and not-quite-clear directions. Both were fine, but leave 90 mins for the travel experience. 2) On the transport front the hotel, although pretty well located, does not seem particularly well known to taxi drivers, so the small translation given to is by the concierge was most appreciated 3) We had a decidedly mixed experience with food. Breakfast can be ok although coffee is a little bitter for my palate and lattes way too milky. If you decide to go a la carte be warned that a cup of tea will cost you 1,100 Yen which borders on outrageous. Dinner was expensive and very ordinary. Suggest you go out!4) there is free coffee and tea available near the lobby (& treats). Which is great, except that it makes the 1,100¥ cup of tea a few feet away extra annoying5) There is a lovely Spa, Gym and swimming pool on a lower floor with a beautiful view of the city6) the staff were very kind and professional I still recommend the Andaz, but now a little wiser having visited it.

Modern and stylish decor, spacious, convenient, and friendly staff. Excellent hotel for business or vacation, whether you're traveling alone or with family. Will definitely go back to Andaz when I'm in Tokyo next time.

memorable stay.. andaz is a 5 star city hotel full of facilities. from the parking area upon arrival you can understand the high standars that they provide. spacious room and bathroom with fantastic city view. lounge and breakfast area very good.the sushi restaurant on 52nd floor very good(expensive)but averange. pool area and spa must visit,so relaxing at the evening time.

This is my go to hotel in Tokyo. No matter if I'm in town for business or pleasure Andaz Tokyo is my choice when in this wonderful place. I came back for a second and third time with my mom and a fourth also with my dad in the months of September and October. Andrea Lobo, the front office manager, was a big part in making our three stays in 2016 very memorable. She made sure we were well taken care of during our stays.Andaz tokyo is the perfect city hotel. It has everything I could possibly need without being opulent or extravagant. The hotels decor and design is maybe my favorite part, inspired in Japanese traditions and paying homage to minimalism. The use of wood throughout the hotel give the minimalism a feel of warmth. You certainly experience a quiet form of luxury at this hotel, I love it!Breakfast is complete and of very high quality. While the options may not be the most extensive in the world or as in other hotels like the Park Hyatt, you get everything you need and the service is also great. I love the location of this hotel; while it is not super central, it is very close to Ginza and other major areas. Also the subway is just four short blocks away and you can get anywhere with that in Tokyo. This is my favorite hotel in Tokyo and also possibly one of my favorite in the world. Can't wait to be back at my home away from home in Tokyo!

New York City, New York

review_body: the hotel is very cozy and comfortable and hotel staff is also friendly! The breakfast is also delicious and with a good view. As the room is on high floor, each room has a good view. My room can see the bay and Odaiba!

I spend 150+ nights/year in hotels but have experienced such a seamless customer experience maybe three times only before this stay. The hotel staff are at the top of their game and provide exemplary service. Hotel design is fantastic and overall guest experience is world class. Hotel may not be in most exciting neighborhood but with Ginza a few stops away on the subway this is a tiny quibble.

Location, correspondence, feeling, everything is the best. It will make your stay in Tokyo very nice. There are few rooms and it is a good hotel that makes me feel at home. I love this hotel. My friend liked this hotel very much. Also, breakfast is very delicious.

おにも ね
Nagoya, Japan

review_body: This hotel is excellent. We have visited several times and on each occasion we were treated with astounding service and immaculate rooms. The bath tubs are amazing - enough alone to secure a return. The room service is excellent and the breakfast sets the bar high for other Hyatt brand hotels. I highly recommend!

I have travelled extensively and have stayed in numerous 5 star hotels including the best in Tokyo ( Imperial, Peninsula, Park Hyatt etc.) Andaz Tokyo made quite an impression on meService was the best I have experienced in a whileFacilitates are modern, unique and tasteful.Suites are a dream.Views of the city are to die for.Not to be missed next time you are in Tokyo.

Paid about SGD 1500 per night as we had requested for the Tokyo Tower view. Room and service was nice. Disappointed in lack of vegetarian meal selection. My husband also informed the hotel to surprise me with roses, the hotel could hv done better with the bouquet with the amount he had paid for.

ANDAZ Hotel, after stayed in Shanghai and was so happy that I made my choice when I was in Tokyo. I didn't disappoint myself either.I was really satisfied with my choice.From the entrance ,to the reception,and concierge of staff were very kind.Thank you very much. The atmosphere of the this Hotel and the interior I feel a simple and calm Japanese style. The room was tidy and wide, and it was very clean. The bed was comfortable and slept well.There weren't many kinds of breakfast, but the food was delicious. Especially, the dishes were so unique and pretty that I was impressed.Specially, I ordered gin tonic from the bar.Then Gin is too much for me, that is not staff fault. So I ordered tonic water again, and the staff made it again for free. How can I not be touched of this kind service?The merit is a very kind staff. And I will never forgetIf visit Tokyo again, my 1st priority is Hotel ANDAZ

We stayed in between the business trip to Tokyo. Location is off away from subway station based on Tokyo standards. Actually it's only 5-8min walk to subway; for tourist standards it's not bad at all. Room is amazing, floor to ceiling windows with long stretched window seats. Large bathtub enough to fit 2! There's a rice crackers from local store, tea/coffee service by the lobby. Downside: gym is not free. Japan is the only country does not provide free use of gym. Why??? Shanghai Andaz even offers indoor pool. They need to accommodate International standards.

very nice, spacious and well maintained hotel. i strongly recommend to those who look for a new and spacious hotel room in Tokyo. room is very comfortable in any point. The only disadvantage is location ( it is not located near to any shopping or restaurant)

Had stayed there twice on family xmas holidays. Location a bit far from city but very nicely designed hotel. Room is big and nicely lay out. The mattress and bedsheet are super nice. We ordered burgers for supper, the price was reasonable and its really good

If you wish to experience the best view of Tokyo, this place is where to stay! Opened in 2014, brand new, chic Japanese modern interior. The facility offers good Tavern, sushi counter and roof top bar. AO spa offers seasonal treatments in a calm ambience. The gym facility is great too! Highly recommended

We loved this hotel so much we returned the following week! The views are stunning, the rooms modern and cost. The staff couldn't be nicer and more helpful. We loved the breakfast - a wonderful range of western and Japanese food. The rooms had amazing views, an espresso machine, a kettle, and enormous bathrooms.
user_name:
LaraHoltz
New York City, New York

review_body: On my most recent trip to Tokyo, I split my stay at the Park Hyatt and here. Long story short: I still prefer the Park Hyatt (by far), but the Andaz is an EXCELLENT hotel and I'd consider staying again at the Andaz if I needed to be closer to this part of Tokyo.The hotel is beautiful, and is the great blend of top-notch Japanese hospitality and Andaz modern/hip vibe and quality. The room had a beautiful view looking out toward Rainbow Bridge. Great hotel. You'll find nothing but top-notch service and accommodations here.

Beautiful property with stunning modern/contemporary design details and gorgeous views of the city. The complimentary happy hour is a terrific touch and I noticed they leave out coffee throughout the day and some pastries in the morning which is also very generous (on top of the amazing free snacks like the wasabi crackers in the room). The free tea in the room is also top notch.The room design is stunning and pretty spacious. The concierge team is first rate here and goes above and beyond in helping you with your requests. They helped us plan so many memorable dinners and translate random websites and locate specific goods we wanted to buy. The only downside is that it isn't next to any major subway stops, but there is always taxis waiting and the staff is great about helping you communicate with the drivers. I look forward to returning here.

We were at the Andaz for a family vacation. The concierge was like having our own personal travel agent. Our activities were printed out for us each day and the vacation went without a single hitch. The staff was so friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend this hotel!!

beautifully designed hotel; stylish, spacious, comfortable rooms with stunning city views; impeccable service; nice gym facilities and pool; convenient central location with several metro lines nearby; ample hotel dining options and more restaurants in the building complex

Andaz Tokyo took me by surprise on this trip to Tokyo. Location was good for me and the view from my room was amazing of the Tokyo sky tree at night. Bed was comfy, shower was strong and free snacks in the room each day. Breakfast however could be improved in variety and quality. Just try out Andaz and you will love it. Yes before I forget they have a great gym for your morning workouts ( with a view) and a fabulous lap pool to swim your tension away. Enjoy.

I stayed here for 16 days for a business trip and it was one of my best hotel experiences in the world. The property is located in a very nice part of Tokyo, and close to many of the attractions. The hotel is inside a state of the art business building with many restaurants inside it. There is also a good coffee shop in the building called the Toranomon Coffee.My hotel room had the view of the city facing east. I could not have been happier. The lobby of the hotel is fabulous and what a cool concept to have a living room area in the lobby to get free coffee, drinks, pastry, newspaper and much more. It does not feel like a hotel but a very nice house of someone. The minor details of the hotel are very nice, it just livens up your experience staying away from home.The breakfast is fabulous with plenty of options for fresh fruits, seafood, pastry, eggs, etc. The hotel room is well appointed with nice bed, very good toiletry, soft pillows and towels and a safe and sound environment. The gym has plenty of good machines and a view you cannot beat. The swimming pool and hot tubs are just as nice.The service of everyone working here is very professional and cannot be compared to some of the other big chain hotel experiences.I am looking forward to staying at more of the Andaz properties!

Awesome property with exceptional service, views over the city, great gym and comfortable rooms. At check in they knew my family would be joining midweek and thus arranged adjoining rooms. Overall service quality and attentiveness is very good.

The Andaz was a lovely hotel with excellent service. Everything was done with care and pride. The spa was especially tranquil and clean. And our view of Mount Fuji from the room was breathtaking. Totally blew away our expectations

Guest room is very cozy and spacious with great view amd a big bathtub. View from any place in the hotel, such as restaurants, gym and swimming, is great as well. There are also many restaurants in the lower leves of the same building which is very convenient.

We loved this hotel - as others have described , your arrival can be confusing- but once you get into the elevator and whisked to the calm lobby all is well! The rooms are beautiful, large, zen and with amazing views. The gym and spa is incredible- make sure to visit at least once.
user_name:
maddeline
New York City, New York

review_body: If you are traveling to Tokyo and you are able to truly treat yourself, take advantage of the wonderful world that is Andaz Toranomon. The views are amazing - I could see Tokyo Tower, the bay and Mount Fuji from my room on the 48th floor. The breakfast buffet was delicious - make sure you wake up hungry and make a few trips to the buffet to sample everything (especially the bread pudding!). And finish your day with drinks and snacks in the lounge - live music, wonderful views and attentive staff. Added bonus - there was a wedding occurring over the weekend and was able to see a number of ladies in beautiful traditional garb. While not a guarantee to see, I'm sure the hotel is used for many weddings and sightings are often!

Stayed at hotel as I was also hosting an event there, and couldn't have been more impressed. Andaz features some of the best design elements I've ever seen at a hotel. Yes, the lobby and walkways can be a bit confusing but i'll take all of the unique subtleties rather than big signage all over the place. The views from the rooms are remarkable -- I actually was sad to leave.

The hotel is good facilities with a very nice spa and swimming pool. ( Also gym and sauna ) Hotel room is decorated wood with bright light very different to the bathroom. They use dark colour as the main theme. ( Bath room is spacious and clean ). The hotel bar is a nice place to hang out or nice sum up of the date with wide ranges and interesting cocktails drink. The place itself is very ambience and cozy. Spent some time here at night won't regret you.

Views to kill for. Huge room with walk in wardrobe and a tub that could fit 5. Complementary wine, sake and snacks at the lounge every evening. Excellent service. Location wise it's about 5mins walk to the train station. Located in the business district. Not convenient if you're expecting to go to touristy places. Lovely garden and good variety of restaurants downstairs. Staff speak excellent English and are formally friendly.

We came to Andaz for attending the meetup event happened there.Disclaimer: Both of us are living in Tokyo Area, henceforth we didn't stay at this hotel. For more info on rooms, please refer to other reviewers. Sorry for the inconvenience caused.We had a good time at a mini party venue between the dim elevator hall and Andaz entrance. It was also connected to the Mori Tower (mixture of luxury stores and offices) at Toranomon. Good connectivity. Swift services. Wish we were rich enough to book a room with this hotel, it would be a great to stay there! Also we (2 veggies) could not eat the food as it was for meat eaters, but we hope this hope can improve this matter.

Great stay for a few days while in Tokyo. Beautiful tower with check in on the 51st floor. Amazing staff and great service. Close to the subway stations and easy to access other major areas of the city.

My third stay in Andaz Tokyo. I have mixed feeling towards the property. Many guests shared the same observations signage is lacking from lounge to room elevator. Esp on the room floor, as you stepped out of the elevator. Dim dark wood made it very difficult to note the room number signage waist-level dark wood.The concierge have tried hard yet quite futile they are not knowledgeable enough to identify guests' preference and wants. Restaurants recommendations are too stereotyped, should have known repeated guests or frequent business travellers expect new restaurants recommendations.The design of the room baffled me always. From the bathroom washbasin counter, to the bedside table, there is a gap between the wall, my belongings always fall thru there. The sharp corner of the platform type bed, bruise ad cut my calf a few times, as I noticed they have wrapped the wood bed frame. I believe there must be quite a bit of complaints. Bar service is cold and unwelcoming. The staff were not cool but cold. Breakfast spread is good, tea was served in cup not in teapot that is uncommon in 5-star hotel. Only proximity to client office, I would stay Andaz. If I have a choice, with such rate, there are quite a few good luxury options.

New and relatively convenient location. Great Andaz experience and service. Staff were attentive and service was excellent. Not a problem unique to this hotel but a general suggestion is to offer a genuine early check in option (even for nominal charge, i.e., NOT 1/2 night charge and certainly not full night charge). This will go a long way to distinguish hotel from others. .

We had sort of a mixed experience at this hotel. The reception/checking folks were super friendly, but the people in the lobby Bar were incredibly rude and unhelpful. The room itself was cool, but the main floor lobby/interior of the building to get to the hotel front desk check in was difficult and hard to find so it was frustrating. Especially when it's late and you're cold and tired and hauling two cases and there is really no signage, you can't tell where to go or how to get to the hotel check-in. This is one of those hotels that tries so hard to be "cool" and modern that it is on the verge of being just annoying. Where the doors just look like walls, and there is no signage, you're just supposed to know where to go. I get that the ultramodern design thing is "hip" but there is such a thing as taking it too far.I will say though that the room had incredible views, and probably the greatest bath tub of just about any hotel I have ever been in.With better signage, more helpful staff, and friendlier service people in the bar, I could easily see this being a five-star hotel. This price though, I expected better service.

Great and beautifully designed hotel. Within walking distance of the Ginza subway line and a handful of shops and restaurants. It was just a short cab ride to Tokyo station (for the bullet train) and a 35 minute ($60) cab ride from Haneda Airport.
user_name:
NYCIan
New York City, New York

review_body: I have stayed at this hotel just shy of 10 times, I would certainly go back in the future. Overall, a very good hotel, the best Andaz I have stayed in (compare with Shanghai, New York and London's Andaz(s) I have stayed in).Great building, very clean and nice. Staff is friendly, breakfast is great (though should have a wee bit more choices) and rooms are good.A few issues why it did not get full marks from me:1) Check in time can be lengthy - seems confusing between the reception area and the coffee/drinks area while checking in. Need to improve on that.2) Getting to your room can be challenging especially when you get out on the room floor - the room numbers are ridiculously difficult to read (I find it by remembering whether I am on the shorter or longer ends of the corridor)3) bars lack personality compared to say other hotels like Mandarin, Palace Hotel or even Grand Hyatt!

While a bit confusing to navigate, this is a beautiful hotel with great views of the Tokyo Tower. After taking the bus to the hotel, we were greeted at the door where we were escorted up to the 51st floor lobby to check in. It's a bit confusing with the three sets of elevators: one to go from the ground floor to the 51st floor lobby, one to go to the spa and the rooms and then one to go up to the 52nd floor for the rooftop bar.The rooms are well-appointed with great views. Like the other Hyatt properties, the bathroom is very nicely put together, although the round tub is a bit odd. It was hard to lay down in the tub to take a bath, but it is a lovely bathroom with the toto washlets that I love.The A&O spa/gym was also very nice, although much smaller than the ones at the Park Hyatt and the Grand Hyatt, which are gems that are among the best for the entire Hyatt chain. The hot tub was dark and small, but I was happy to be able to soak in 42C hot water, unlike some of the other Hyatt properties outside Japan. The gym is quite nice, but my views are skewed as I was just at the Grand Hyatt Singapore, where the gym is the size of a regular gym.The breakfast was one of the highlights of the hotel, with a great mix of western dishes and Japanese breakfast. The hotel is at Toranomon Hills Mori Tower, which did take a few minutes to get to the two closest subway stop. I do prefer the Grand Hyatt and Park Hyatt in Tokyo in that they are both grander experiences; however, the Andaz was really excellent. It was very nice to have the juice and water in our fridge as well as the lobby area to consume throughout our stay.
user_name:
awc4
New York City, New York

review_body: Location:Centrally located within Tokyo and within a few minutes walking distance from Toranomon Station. Andaz offers a commanding view of the area with barely any other buildings blocking your view. Room:Tower View King – Our room had an amazing view of Tokyo tower and on a clear enough day one can spot Mt. Fuji. Even with a south facing view the curtains do a good job for blocking out unwanted sunlight for the jet lagged traveler. Service:We arrived by taxi and we were a bit surprised that we had to carry our own bags to the lobby considering the price range of the rooms. Once in the lobby it took 15 mins for someone from reception to greet us. This felt rather awkward waiting around while staff walked past you.Aside from the greeting service the hotel and the room were as expected.

The service, location and everything about this hotel was excellent. Great spa and swimming pool - roof top bar and really comfortable rooms with an excellent view of Tokyo.The only slight negative was the price, the bar and restaurant prices were very high even for Tokyo.We certainly enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to anyone visiting Tokyo

This is one of the most excellent hotels I have ever visited. I would place it in my top 3 ever, and that is saying something because I travel a lot.The check-in was personal and so efficient. The rooms are delightful, large with great bathroom and closet space. My room had a view over Tokyo tower.The service was perfect through-out - attentive but not intrusive. I cal lout for special attention the manager of reception who helped fix my reading glasses when they lost a screw, but most of all the totally perfect service from Toshie Honma, Andaz Tavern assistant manager. She was always smiling, always attentive, her English is very good and she gave us wonderful service. The tavern has a lovely atmosphere, including for afternoon tea and cakes in the Japanese way. The food in the restaurant is excellent, both breakfast, lunch and dinner which I ate several times.The spa was lovely, and the massage I had was great.I cannot fault this hotel. It is perfect. It will be my top choice when in Tokyo.

Expensive? Yes. Worth it? You bet!This was my 4th stay at the Andaz Tokyo. And once again, it was perfect! I think that this may be the best hotel I've ever stayed in.First, a heartfelt "great job" to all the staff. They make the difference between great and perfect. A special "congratulations" to Andrea Lobo and her team. No feat is too difficult for them! I was trying to have my flights changed, and could not manage, one of her team members took the matter upon herself, and I got on the flight I wanted. This is a team of people that other luxury hotel concierge / front office staff should learn from. Friendly, caring, polite, "can-do" attitude. Bravo! It's because of this team of people that I've already booked my next stay there, and will make the Andaz my home in Tokyo.Now, let me also say that I am a Diamond Hyatt Gold Passport member. This meant that I did get a room upgrade, which was great, free breakfast, and a late checkout, which worked perfectly. But, regardless, the experience there is flawless.Another highlight of the stay is the room. Huge, by Tokyo standards, very well appointed, and with an amazing view from floors 47-50 where the rooms are located. At night we slept with the blinds up, to soak up this amazing view of this great city. One suggestion to the hotel: upgrade the cable TV offerings. Not enough English channels to watch if you decide to stay in at night.One problem with a noise that we encountered when the wind was blowing very hard outside our room was quickly acknowledged, and we got a little "sorry" note and an amazing box of cookies as an apology, even though it was not the hotel's fault. That goes back to the service levels I mentioned earlier.One more pointer to the hotel: The bathrobes are great, but anyone at 1,82m height and 120 kilos weight simply won't fit... Why not have a few spare XXL ones somewhere, and sneak them in when a large guest arrives..? ;-)The restaurant is fantastic, and serves a great breakfast buffet (made even better when it's free for Diamond Members!). Another suggestion: don't use butter to saute and fry otherwise vegan dishes, like mushrooms and potatoes. It reduces the choices of vegan guests, or guests who don't eat dairy. The view from the restaurant is also amazing.Another property highlight is the Bar on the 52nd floor. Great cocktails, a great selections of super premium liquor brands, and well priced for the location.The location is great, a 20 minute walk from Ginza, and a short 5 minute walk to the nearest Ginza line metro station.Very highly suggested!

I traveled with my adult daughter and our double bedded room was very comfortable. The window is floor to ceiling with a long natural cut wooden table the width of the window with two comfortable desk type chairs... lots of room for working or unpacking! Would definitely stay again! Great staff too!

Everything for Andaz Hotel is fantastic. However, Only transportation is Poor, if you would like to use Public. When I would like to go shopping Ginza, Marunouchi Area, I felt the location is a little bit unconvenient for me.

OMG. The view made me never want to leave my room (and that's a problem because there's so much to do in Tokyo). The room + bathroom was HUGE on Tokyo standards. The rest of the hotel was stunningly beautiful. The pool was one of the best parts of the hotel. DO NOT MISS. Go to the top floor and enjoy a drink while staring at all the blinking red lights of the city.

Wonderful hotel with top notch amenities and good service. Despite the surrounding area being under construction for the Olympics, the location is centrally located and easy access to business and sightseeing. The stay was wonderful as you would expect from a 5 star hotel. I religiously stay at the Palace Hotel while in Tokyo, but now I have a new, better in some respect, option while in Japan.

Great location, easy access to 3 rain/subway lines, many rent and return bicycle station in the area. Interesting little restaurants open till late night as many locals white collars hang out after work for from nearby commercial districts.Superb service, many many details from check in to check out, one example is that they always put out some snacks and wine in the lobby common area area so it's always fun to hang out a bit to refresh after a day of sightseeing (or working if it is a business trip) and be ready for go out to dinner.Beautiful room, all the hard wood, so warm and cozy and breathtaking view. The selections at the free of charge mini bar are fantastic.Wonderful facilities, a real piece of advise, plan ahead to reserve a 3 hours block of free time to enjoy their pool, whirlpool, onsen, sauna. I know it is hard with so much to do and so little time in Tokyo. I am glad I did ;)

We booked the King Suite with Tower View. The view was phenomenal, waking up to an amazing sunrise over Tokyo every morning! Room was cleaned to perfection every day. Bathroom had a massive sink which was very useful and the shower and bath were a joy to use. Would highly recommend to anybody who wants to stay in Tokyo.No free alcohol in the mini bar. Communal sauna would have been nice in the Spa.

Unless you have Breakfast included in your room rate skip the idea of having it in the Tavern dinning area. I ordered off the menu and was really disappointed in the quality of the food. Simple pancakes were rock hard and overpriced. The staff is very polite but the food is underwhelming.

I stayed here on a business trip with a group. The other people in my group (5) were men and caucasians. Everyone got the room of their choice except myself, the only female asian. They gave me 2 single beds instead of the usual (King) and told me all the rooms were full.Next day, I found out that my other female asian colleague who checked in at a separate hour, had the exact same treatment. The hotel also gave her 2 single bed. Upon check in, I was also asked to show my business card to verify my identity, in addition to my passport. I stayed at different Hyatt hotels on business trips because I have company rates but this is the only one asking for business card. I had to open my gigantic suitcase in the lobby to look for my business card. On checkout day, I had to leave early to catch a flight. On the way to the elevator, I saw a naked, white man hiding behind the screens in the corridor standing outside one of the guest rooms. He looked very embarrassed.Needless to say I was completely horrified. What was more incomprehensible is when I informed the front desk staff, he didn't try to find out more about what happened. He looked slightly surprised, but quickly resumed his administrative work to process my check out. Perhaps there's something Japanese that I fail to understand, but to a foreigner I thought the attitude of the hotel completely condescending.

We couldn't have had a more comfortable and stylish room, with a better view, with better staff, anywhere else. We went on to an Intercontinental and a Four Seasons after this stay in Tokyo, and the Andaz was our favorite for all the reasons stated above.

Wonderful location, spacious room, excellent services, and they even have free cloths to be borrowed for me to access the gym. Best of the hotel I have visited thus far. Will look forward to be back here

Andaz Tokyo is one of the finest hotels available for guests visiting Tokyo. Highly recommend it for its convenient location and upscale amenities. Celebrated our honeymoon and the hotel helped make our stay more enjoyable with a nice gift.

I stayed here during a business trip and to be fair it is perfect for business stays. It is on the high range of hotels and offers all the facilities: fitness area, sauna and beauty salon. The restaurant gives a nice view of the city and food is fusion. Service is impeccable, but then in Japan it is not easy to find bad service

The Andaz is an oasis in the middle of the city. From the moment you arrive your every need is met in a very zen setting. The rooms are well appointed and modern and the lobby area is amazing. The service is attentive and personal and the happy hour every evening is a lovely way to relax. One side of the hotel has spectacular views of the Tokyo Tower and Mt. Fiji in the distance. I would definitely come back to the Andaz.

Andaz was a modern luxury oasis in the exciting energy of Tokyo. This hotel will become my go-to property in one of my favorite cities in the world.What's Right- the views, the views, the views! Ask for the Tokyo Bay side for the most amazing views!- my room was incredibly quiet, never heard anyone anywhere, perfect for sleeping through jet lag- pool (with a view) was lovely- location was great for morning walks- roof bar (did I mention the views!) was a chic way to unwind in the evening- little sushi restaurant was a special treat, the tasting menu was an experienceI can't wait to return to the Andaz!
user_name:
CB328
New York City, New York

review_body: Everything about the Andaz is amazing! Everything! The food is incredible. The rooms and space are awesome. The views are breathtaking. This is by far the best hotel I've ever stayed at in my life. And bonus: the staff all spoke some english as well. The breakfast buffet will blow your mind. The lobby on the 51st floor?? Game changer. I cannot wait to go back to Japan, just to stay at the Andaz hotel. It was really that good.

Stayed one night to celebrate our wedding anniversary and it turned out it was a great call for Tokyo city staycation. Enjoyed a great view of Tokyo tower from the room in the night time and had a delicious dinner at Tavern with finishing our night at the roof top bar with fresh winds.

I went in the room to the expectations,there is no induction signboard to the hotel 's entrance and front,it took time to go to the front,To get lost even my Japanese,do you as customers from other countries okey? Do not stand in your eyes,kindness of the hotel is the hotel invisible.

We were upgraded to an amazing view of Tokyo Tower. The view was the best we've ever had. We spent 4 days here and 3 days at the Park Hyatt. It's a little awkward finding the entrance and lobby. It's on the 51st floor. The hotel concierge was one of the best I've ever had help with. They got us reservations at Jiro's a month in advance, which is nearly impossible. For that reason alone I'll already rate them 5 stars. This location is a further out from the center of all the action. It's more geared towards business and has the same type of vibe. The subway isn't as far out as most people have mentioned. It's a short 10 minute walk. The breakfast is a bit overpriced and overrated. The view from the restaurant is spectacular, but we've had better food. The gym and pool are really nice. Was impressed with the gym for a hotel gym. They actually have a squat rack. Albeit a squat rack with an attached bar, but a squat rack nonetheless. Wasn't too happy about the charge of 1000 Yen for a short domestic call we made to our other hotel. Was surprised how expensive it was for a call that lasted a couple minutes and was local. tl;dr: amazing hotel. Quiet area. 10 minute walk to subway. Great view of Tokyo Tower. Top notch concierge to help with bookings. Would stay again.

It was my first stay at the Andaz and I went with no expectations. The hotel had a slightly different concept than the ones I had previously stayed at but was all quite refreshing. I thoroughly enjoyed the sky bar and the music that was played. Great place to hv a drink or two with a chilled environment.

I can't imagine a nicer hotel in Tokyo than the Andaz. It's stylish and modern, with a wonderful Japanese simplicity. Every employee I encountered was quick to help, and the drinks and canapes were delicious. They also upgraded my wife and I to a room with a view of Tokyo Tower. I'll definitely be back!

The Andaz is one of the newest top end hotels in Tokyo, and it shows. I cannot figure out why, but somehow I never clicked with the room. Yes it spacious, but I found the configuration awkward - especially the way the closet is integrated to the bathroom. The build-in sofa was not very comfortable. The service was impeccable like you would expect everywhere in Japan. The gym was the real positive. Clearly not an afterthought like in many Tokyo hotel, but properly though out with fantastic views over the Palace and metropolitan Tokyo. Proper pool for laps and nice wet facilities.And importantly, no stupid extra charges to use them. I was disappointed with the restaurant as for breakfast the only choice was full buffet. So if you don't pay for the full breakfast you are not eating room service is the only alternative. Finally, I find the location bit awkward. It is not really in a walking distance to anything, and the closest subway stop is bit of walk. For the same money, I'll go back to Peninsula next time.

This was the second time I stayed in an Andaz, the New York Wall Street Andaz was great, but I think this Andaz is even better. This hotel offers excellent hardware and software in short. Stayed in this hotel for two nights only as a shot getaway with Hyatt point + cash and the stay was very memorableHardware:1. Stunning skyline views from lobby and rooms2. Artistic, warm and cozy decor around the hotel3. Extremely spacious room with large deep soaking tub and separate rain shower4. Complimentary snacks and non alcoholic drinks from minibar5. Complimentary evening wine, sake and canapés, selection is limited but quality is very good6. Very good breakfast, with selection of Japanese and western items. Good selection of local fruits and cereal too.7. Tea and coffee at lounge is very convenient to tourists like us returning late at night8. Great skyline view from pool, and we really enjoyed the Jacuzzi and carbonated hot water bath in the pool area, this is one of the best features of this hotel9. Fresh floral arrangements in room making it cozy and warm10. Location is not too central to major shopping areas but it's close to metro station and walking distance to the tokyo tower and palaceSoftware1. Very personalized service, received email from hotel asking me about my arrival time, early checkin was offered at 9am in the morning as we traveled a red eye flight2. Staffs are extremely friendly and attentiveThe only minor downside was the turndown service, you have to request for it and it's not done in a fully proper manner.ConclusionVery good hotel in general, room rate is not low but I believe the quality and service worth every penny you spent.

Very attentive and welcoming staffs Spacious room with great bathroom featuring a large tub Stunning breathtaking skyline view of tokyo Warm, artistic and cozy decor all around the hotel Overall a great experience

Love the Andaz. Big, modern rooms. Great bed and bathroom. Perfect soaking tub. Great views given that the hotel begins on a high floor. Fantastic pool and hot tub/jets area... really unique way they designed the salt water jets. Great service as you would expect from a top-tier Japanese hotel.I guess the only negative is that there is nothing really around it, and you're captive to the upper-tier restaurants/shops in the Toranomon Hills complex. I would definitely like to stay again if I had the budget.
user_name:
vacationsy
New York City, New York

review_body: Excellent experience and location. Peaceful, open common areas with high ceiling and natural materials. Outstanding, friendly service. Concierge helped arrange tour for my wife. Great room layout and views. Fantastic bathroom, great storage. Business friendly with desk and plenty of outlets including near bed. Buffet breakfast is fantastic. Wish there were more staple dinner options including gluten free. Arranged cars to/ from Narita through hotel- price was a bit excessive. Will definitely repeat

While I agree with some of the other reviewers that the entrance is a little hard to find but so worth the effort. The staff are extremely well trained and efficient. The decor is immaculate and the facilities excellent. We had the basic rooms but still among the best I've seen in. Lots of beautiful wood fittings, draw space, artwork and toiletries. The bath/shower area was extremely nice. The bed very comfortable and very little noise. The view from the 50th floor was amazing. We had dinner at the Tavern and while a little pricy, service and food quality was as excellent as everything else in the hotel. If I had to find fault with anything it would be the rooftop bar - the space was a little cramped and we had smoking right behind where we were sitting rather than in a remote area where non-smokers didn't have to leave smelling of it.

I stayed in a lot of Andaz Hotels and this was the best by far. The entrance was difficult to find as the check in is in the upper floors. The staff was very welcoming and the rooms are amazing. Don't forget to go to the happy hour.

An excellent hotel located in the Toranomon area of Tokyo with high end rooms and excellent service. The location of the property is a part of the Toranomon Hills building complex and would be convenient for meetings in the area but is rather far from Trains and Subway lines. Taxi is the easiest mode of transport to and from the hotel. The local neighborhood is a business district devoid of interesting night life and restaurants. The rooms are nicely styled in a modernist style with natural wood desks and large shower tub combo. The King size room was seizable for Tokyo standards but was far from large in comparison to western rooms. Like many Japanese hotels; there is a lack of English content on their in room entertainment system. I would recommend checking out the bar on the 52nd floor. Its partially outside and with its high location is breezy and cool even on a hot evening.

The andaz Tokyo has every detail covered. The service is impeccable, the hotel is fairly new so the rooms are modern and up to date. From the moment you arrive downstairs to the ride up to the 51st floor, you are surrounded by luxury... And it smells like a spa once you get off on the 51st floor which is incredibly inviting after spending the day pounding the pavement in Tokyo. Concierge was great with recommendations and honestly one of the best breakfast buffets I have ever had at a hotel. The one downside is the location. It's a 10 minute walk to two different subway stations and is somewhat in a business district. It was not incredibly inconvenient (and the amazing views made up for it) but there isn't much within walking distance. With that being said, you can't go wrong with this hotel in Tokyo.

This was my first trip to Tokyo and the Andaz came as a recommendation from colleagues. The staff was fantastic and the room was pristine and welcoming. Beautiful view. I would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Jamie B
Los Angeles, United States

review_body: I highly recommend this hotel for anyone staying in Tokyo. Centrally located and very near the Imperial Palace, I had a great time. Fantastic food, the view amazing and I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Excellent hotel. Close to the Metro Line and 10 -15min walk to JR line. Comfortable bed. Hotel is located in the financial district. I was in Tokyo for business, but had no problem taking the train or taxi to other points of interest. Most taxi rides were $10-20.
I've stayed in this hotel for 3 times and the quality maintain the same high level no matter for hardwares or services, it is truly the world-class; it's no doubt the best hotel I've ever stayed!!!

One of the best Hyatt locations I've stayed at by far. From the check-in process all the way to the check-out, the attention to detail is impeccable. Will visit again for sure if I am ever in Tokyo again.

Andaz is a lovely surprise in Tokyo, recommended by a colleague who had stayed there. The hotel is practically brand new...it is only two-year-old. It is a nice boutique hotel with great design, a mix between traditional and modern. The lobby is on the 51st floor where you are invited to sit, relax and have refreshments while the staff attended to your room registration. The staff will take you to your room and show you around. Since the building is quite high, you have choices of unobstructed view of Tokyo from your room. You can choose the Tokyo Tower view, the rainbow bridge bay view, the Imperial Palace View, or the Shibuya city view etc. Soft drinks in the mini bar are complimentary, but not alcoholic drinks. The swimming pool is indoors and is heated with a jacuzzi next to it. However, I find the jet stream of the jacuzzi to be weak, not like the ones in the Grand Hyatt. The hot spring in the locker room does not have jet stream either. It is more a traditional Japanese hot tub set at 42.5 degrees C. Everything in this hotel has style from the spa to the restaurants. There is a rooftop bar on the 52 floor and I recommend you to visit around 6pm to watch the city lights come on. The Andaz Grill on the 51st floor is a good place for lunch and the menu is fusion. I tried the Hokkaido Paella. Ask for a window seat so you will be treated to photo perfect views.
